Make vows to Yahweh your God and keep them. May all who surround him bring gifts to him who is to be feared.
He cuts off the spirit of the princes; he is feared by the kings of the earth.

I will call out with my voice to God; I will call with my voice to God, and my God will hear me.
In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord; at night I stretched my hands out, and they would not become tired. My soul refused to be comforted.
I thought of God as I groaned; I thought about him as I grew faint. Selah
You held my eyes open; I was too troubled to speak.
I thought about the days of old, about times long past.
During the night I called to mind the song I once sang. I thought carefully and tried to understand what had happened.
Will the Lord reject me forever? Will he never again show me favor?
Was his covenant faithfulness gone forever? Had his promise failed forever?
Had God forgotten to be gracious? Had his anger shut off his compassion? Selah
I said, “This is my sorrow: the changing of the right hand of the Most High toward us.”
But I will call to mind your deeds, Yahweh; I will think about your wonderful deeds of old.
I will ponder all your deeds and will reflect on them.
Your way, God, is holy; what god compares to our great God?
You are the God who does wonders; you have revealed your strength among the peoples.
You gave your people victory by your great power— the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
The waters saw you, God; the waters saw you, and they were afraid; the depths trembled.
The clouds poured down water; the cloudy skies gave voice; your arrows flew about.
Your thunderous voice was heard in the wind; the lightning lit up the world; the earth trembled and shook.
Your path went through the sea and your way through the surging waters, but your footprints were not seen.
You led your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

Hear my teaching, my people, listen to the words of my mouth.
I will open my mouth in parables; I will sing about hidden things about the past.
These are things that we have heard and learned, things that our ancestors have told us.
We will not keep them from their descendants. We will tell the next generation about the praiseworthy deeds of Yahweh, his strength, and the wonders that he has done.
For he established covenant decrees in Jacob and appointed a law in Israel. He commanded our ancestors that they were to teach them to their children.
He commanded this so that the generation to come might know his decrees, the children not yet born, who should tell them in turn to their own children.
Then they would place their hope in God and not forget his deeds but keep his commandments.
Then they would not be like their ancestors, who were a stubborn and rebellious generation, a generation whose hearts were not right, and whose spirits were not committed and faithful to God.
The Ephraimites were armed with bows, but they turned back on the day of battle.
They did not keep the covenant with God, and they refused to obey his law.
They forgot his deeds, the wonderful things that he had shown them.
They forgot the marvelous things he did in the sight of their ancestors in the land of Egypt, in the land of Zoan.
He divided the sea and led them across it; he made the waters to stand like walls.
In the daytime he led them with a cloud and all the night with the light of fire.
He split the rocks in the wilderness, and he gave them water abundantly, enough to fill the depths of the sea.
He made streams flow out of the rock and made the water flow like rivers.
Yet they continued to sin against him, rebelling against the Most High in the wilderness.
They challenged God in their hearts by asking for food to satisfy their appetites.
They spoke against God; they said, “Can God really lay out a table for us in the wilderness?
See, when he struck the rock, waters gushed out and streams overflowed. But can he give bread also? Will he provide meat for his people?”
When Yahweh heard this, he was angry; so his fire burned against Jacob, and his anger attacked Israel,
because they did not believe in God and did not trust in his salvation.
Yet he commanded the skies above and opened the doors of the sky.
He rained down manna for them to eat, and gave them the grain from heaven.
People ate the bread of angels. He sent them food in abundance.
He caused the east wind to blow in the sky, and by his power he guided the south wind.
He rained down meat on them like dust, birds as numerous as the sands of the sea.
They fell in the middle of their camp, all around their tents.
So they ate and were full. He gave them what they craved.
But they had not yet filled up; their food was still in their mouths.
Then God's anger attacked them and killed the strongest of them. He brought down the young men of Israel.
Despite this, they continued to sin and did not believe his wonderful deeds.
Therefore God cut short their days; their years were filled with terror.
Whenever God afflicted them, they would start to seek him, and they would return and look earnestly for him.
They would call to mind that God was their rock and that the Most High God was their rescuer.
But they would flatter him with their mouth and lie to him with their words.
For their hearts were not firmly fixed on him, and they were not faithful to his covenant.
Yet he, being merciful, forgave their iniquity and did not destroy them. Yes, many times he held back his anger and did not stir up all his wrath.
He called to mind that they were made of flesh, a wind that passes away and does not return.
How often they rebelled against him in the wilderness and grieved him in the barren regions!
Again and again they challenged God and offended the Holy One of Israel.
They did not think about his power, how he had rescued them from the enemy
when he performed his terrifying signs in Egypt and his wonders in the region of Zoan.
He turned the Egyptians' rivers to blood so that they could not drink from their streams.
He sent swarms of flies that devoured them and frogs that overran their land.
He gave their crops to the grasshopper and their labor to the locust.
He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore trees with more hail.
He rained hail on their cattle and hurled lightning bolts at their livestock.
The fierceness of his anger lashed out against them. He sent wrath, fury, and trouble like agents who bring disaster.
He leveled a path for his anger; he did not spare them from death but gave them over to the plague.
He killed all the firstborn in Egypt, the firstborn of their strength in the tents of Ham.
He led his own people out like sheep and guided them through the wilderness like a flock.
He led them secure and unafraid, but the sea overwhelmed their enemies.
Then he brought them to the border of his holy land, to this mountain that his right hand acquired.
He drove out the nations from before them and assigned them their inheritance. He settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.
Yet they challenged and defied the Most High God and did not keep his solemn commands.
They were unfaithful and acted treacherously like their fathers; they were as undependable as a faulty bow.
For they made him angry with their high places and provoked him to jealous anger with their idols.
When God heard this, he was angry and completely rejected Israel.
He abandoned the sanctuary of Shiloh, the tent where he had lived among people.
He allowed his strength to be captured and gave his glory into the enemy's hand.
He handed his people over to the sword, and he was angry with his heritage.
Fire devoured their young men, and their young women had no wedding songs.
Their priests fell by the sword, and their widows could not weep.
Then the Lord awakened as one from sleep, like a warrior who shouts because of wine.
He drove his adversaries back; he put them to everlasting shame.
He rejected the tent of Joseph, and he did not chose the tribe of Ephraim.
He chose the tribe of Judah and Mount Zion that he loved.
He built his sanctuary like the heavens, like the earth that he has established forever.
He chose David, his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds.
He took him from following the ewes with their young, and he brought him to be shepherd of Jacob, his people, and of Israel, his heritage.
David shepherded them with the integrity of his heart, and he guided them with the skill of his hands.
God, foreign nations have come into your inheritance; they have defiled your holy temple; they have turned Jerusalem into a heap of ruins.
They have given the dead bodies of your servants as food to the birds of the skies, the bodies of your faithful people to the beasts of the earth.
They have shed their blood like water around Jerusalem, and there was none to bury them.
We have become a reproach for our neighbors, mocking and derision to those who are around us.
How long, Yahweh? Will you stay angry forever? How long will your jealous anger burn like fire?
Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not know you and on the kingdoms that do not call upon your name.
For they have devoured Jacob and destroyed his villages.
Do not hold the sins of our forefathers against us; may your merciful actions come to us, for we are very low.
Help us, God of our salvation, for the sake of the glory of your name; save us and forgive our sins for your name's sake.
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” May the blood of your servants that was shed be avenged on the nations before our eyes.
May the groans of the prisoners come before you; with the greatness of your power keep the children of death alive.
Pay back into the laps of our neighboring countries seven times as much as the insults with which they have insulted you, Lord.
So we your people and sheep of your pasture will give you thanks forever. We will tell your praises to all generations.
Pay attention, Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock; you who sit above the cherubim, shine on us!
In the sight of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up your power; come and save us.
God, restore us; make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.
Yahweh God of hosts, how long will you be angry at your people when they pray?
You have fed them with the bread of tears and given them tears to drink in great quantities.
You make us something for our neighbors to argue over, and our enemies laugh about us among themselves.
God of hosts, restore us; make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.
You brought a vine out of Egypt; you drove out nations and transplanted it.
You cleared the land for it; it took root and filled the land.
The mountains were covered with its shade, the cedars of God by its branches.
It sent out its branches as far as the sea and its shoots to the Euphrates River.
Why have you broken down its walls so that all who pass by along the road pluck its fruit?
The boars out of the forest ruin it, and the beasts of the field feed on it.
Turn back, God of hosts; look down from heaven and take notice and take care of this vine.
This is the root that your right hand planted, the shoot that you made to grow.
It has been burned and cut down; they perish because of your rebuke.
May your hand be on the man of your right hand, on the son of man whom you made strong for yourself.
Then we will not turn away from you; revive us, and we will call on your name.
Yahweh God of hosts, restore us; make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.

Sing aloud to God our strength; shout out for joy to the God of Jacob.
Sing a song and play the tambourine, the pleasant lyre with the harp.
Blow the trumpet on the day of the new moon, on the day of the full moon, when our feast day begins.
For it is a statute for Israel, a decree given by the God of Jacob.
He issued it as a regulation in Joseph when he went against the land of Egypt, where I heard a voice that I did not recognize:
“I removed the burden from his shoulder; his hands were freed from holding the basket.
In your distress you called out, and I helped you; I answered you from a dark thundercloud. I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah
Listen, my people, for I will warn you, Israel, if you would only listen to me!
There must be no foreign god among you; you must not worship any foreign god.
I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt. Open your mouth wide, and I will fill it.
But my people did not listen to my words; Israel did not obey me.
So I gave them over to their own stubborn way so that they might do what seemed right to them.
Oh, that my people would listen to me; oh, that my people would walk in my paths.
Then I would quickly subdue their enemies and turn my hand against their oppressors.
May those who hate Yahweh cringe in fear before him! May they be humiliated forever.
I would feed Israel with the finest wheat; I would satisfy you with honey out of the rock.”

God stands in the divine assembly; in the midst of the gods he renders judgment.
How long will you judge unjustly and show favoritism to the wicked? Selah
Defend the poor and fatherless; maintain the rights of the afflicted and destitute.
Rescue the poor and needy; take them out of the hand of the wicked.
They neither know nor understand; they wander around in the darkness; all the foundations of the earth crumble.
I said, “You are gods, and all of you sons of the Most High.
Nevertheless you will die like men and fall like one of the princes.”
Arise, God, judge the earth, for you have an inheritance in all the nations.
God, do not be silent! Do not ignore us and remain unmoved, God.
Look, your enemies are making a commotion, and those who hate you have raised their heads.
They conspire against your people and plan together against your protected ones.
They have said, “Come, and let us destroy them as a nation. Then the name of Israel will no longer be remembered.”
They have schemed together with one strategy; against you they have made an alliance.
This includes the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, and the people of Moab and the Hagrites, who plot together with
Gebal, Ammon, Amalek; it also includes Philistia and the inhabitants of Tyre.
Assyria also is allied with them; they are helping the descendants of Lot. Selah
Do to them as you did to Midian, as you did to Sisera and to Jabin at the Kishon River.
They perished at Endor and became like manure for the earth.
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna.
They said, “Let us take for ourselves the pastures of God.”
My God, make them like the whirling dust, like chaff before the wind,
like the fire that burns the forest, and like the flame that sets the mountains on fire.
Chase them with your strong wind, and terrify them with your windstorm.
Fill their faces with shame so that they might seek your name, Yahweh.
May they be put to shame and be terrified forever; may they perish in disgrace.
Then they will know that you alone, Yahweh, are the Most High over all the earth.

How lovely is the place where you live, Yahweh of hosts!
I long for the courts of Yahweh, my desire for it has made me exhausted. My heart and all of my being call out to the living God.
Even the sparrow has found her a house and the swallow a nest for herself where she may lay her young near your altars, Yahweh of hosts, my King, and my God.
Blessed are they who live in your house; they praise you continually. Selah
Blessed is the man whose strength is in you, in whose heart are the highways up to Zion.
Passing through the Valley of Tears, they find springs of water to drink. The early rains cover it with blessings.
They go from strength to strength; every one of them appears before God in Zion.
Yahweh God of hosts, hear my prayer; God of Jacob, listen to what I am saying! Selah
God, watch over our shield; show concern for your anointed.
For one day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to live within the tents of the wicked.
For Yahweh God is our sun and shield; Yahweh will give grace and glory; he does not withhold any good thing from those who walk in integrity.
Yahweh of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in you.

Yahweh, you have showed favor to your land; you have restored the well-being of Jacob.
You have forgiven the sin of your people; you have covered all their sin. Selah
You have withdrawn all your wrath; you have turned back from your hot anger.
Restore us, God of our salvation, and let go of your displeasure with us.
Will you be angry with us forever? Will you remain angry throughout future generations?
Will you not revive us again? Then your people will rejoice in you.
Show us your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, grant us your salvation.
I will listen to what Yahweh God says, for he will make peace with his people, his faithful followers. Yet they must not turn again to foolish ways.
Surely his salvation is near to those who fear him; then glory will remain in our land.
Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness have met together; righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
Trustworthiness springs up from the ground, and righteousness looks down from the sky.
Yes, Yahweh will give his good blessings, and our land will yield its crops.
Righteousness will go before him and make a way for his footsteps.

Listen, Yahweh, and answer me, for I am poor and oppressed.
Protect me, for I am loyal; my God, save your servant who trusts in you.
Be merciful to me, Lord, for I cry out to you all day long.
Make your servant glad, for to you, Lord, I lift up my soul.
You, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive, and you show great mercy to all those who cry out to you.
Yahweh, listen to my prayer; hear the sound of my pleas.
In the day of my trouble I call on you, for you will answer me.
There is no one who compares to you among the gods, Lord. There are no deeds like your deeds.
All the nations that you have made will come and bow before you, Lord. They will honor your name.
For you are great and do wonderful things; you only are God.
Teach me your ways, Yahweh. Then I will walk in your truth. Unite my heart to reverence you.
Lord my God, I will praise you with my whole heart; I will glorify your name forever.
For great is your covenant faithfulness toward me; you have rescued my life from the depths of Sheol.
God, the arrogant have risen up against me. A gang of violent men seek my life. They have no regard for you.
But you, Lord, are a merciful and gracious God, slow to anger, and abundant in covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness.
Turn toward me and have mercy on me; give your strength to your servant; save the son of your servant woman.
Show me a sign of your favor. Then those who hate me will see it and be put to shame because you, Yahweh, have helped me and comforted me.
On the holy mount stands the city he founded;
Yahweh loves the gates of Zion more than all the tents of Jacob.
Glorious things are said of you, city of God. Selah
“I mention Rahab and Babylon to my followers. See, there are Philistia, and Tyre, along with Cush— and will say, 'This one was born there.'”
Of Zion it will be said, “Each of these was born in her; and the Most High himself will establish her.”
Yahweh writes in the census book of the nations, “This one was born there.” Selah
So also the singers and the dancers say together, “All my fountains are in you.”
Yahweh, God of my salvation, I cry out day and night before you.
Listen to my prayer; pay attention to my cry.
For I am filled with troubles, and my life has reached Sheol.
People treat me like those who go down into the pit; I am a man with no strength.
I am abandoned among the dead; I am like the dead who lie in the grave, about whom you care no more because they are cut off from your power.
You place me in the lowest part of the pit, in the dark and deep places.
Your wrath lies heavy on me, and all your waves crash over me. Selah
Because of you, my acquaintances avoid me. You have made me a shocking sight to them. I am hemmed in and I cannot escape.
My eyes grow weary from trouble; All day long I call out to you, Yahweh; I spread out my hands to you.
Will you do wonders for the dead? Will those who have died rise and praise you? Selah
Will your covenant faithfulness be proclaimed in the grave, your loyalty in the place of the dead?
Will your wonderful deeds be known in the darkness, or your righteousness in the place of forgetfulness?
But I cry to you, Yahweh; in the morning my prayer comes before you.
Yahweh, why do you reject me? Why do you hide your face from me?
I have always been afflicted and on the verge of death since my youth. I have suffered from your terrors; I am in despair.
Your angry actions have passed over me, and your terrifying deeds have annihilated me.
They surround me like water all the day long; they have all encircled me.
You have removed every friend and acquaintance from me. My only acquaintance is the darkness.

I will sing of Yahweh's acts of covenant faithfulness forever. I will proclaim your truthfulness to future generations.
For I have said, “Covenant faithfulness has been established forever; your truthfulness you have established in the heavens.”
“I have made a covenant with my chosen one, I have made an oath to David my servant.
I will establish your descendants forever, and I will establish your throne through all generations.” Selah
The heavens praise your wonders, Yahweh; your truthfulness is praised in the assembly of the holy ones.
For who in the skies can be compared to Yahweh? Who among the sons of the gods is like Yahweh?
He is a God who is greatly honored in the council of the holy ones and is awesome among all who surround him.
Yahweh God of hosts, who is strong like you, Yahweh? Your truthfulness surrounds you.
You rule the raging sea; when the waves surge, you calm them.
You crushed Rahab as one who is killed. You scattered your enemies with your strong arm.
The heavens belong to you, and the earth also. You made the world and all it contains.
You created the north and the south. Tabor and Hermon rejoice in your name.
You have a mighty arm and a strong hand, and your right hand is high.
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne. Covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness come before you.
Blessed are the people who worship you! Yahweh, they walk in the light of your face.
They rejoice in your name all day long, and in your righteousness they exalt you.
You are their majestic strength, and by your favor we are victorious.
For our shield belongs to Yahweh; our king belongs to the Holy One of Israel.
Long ago you spoke in a vision to your faithful ones; you said, “I have set a crown on a mighty one.” I have raised up one chosen from among the people.
I have chosen David my servant; with my holy oil have I anointed him.
My hand will support him; my arm will strengthen him.
No enemy will deceive him; no son of wickedness will oppress him.
I will crush his enemies before him; I will kill those who hate him.
My truth and my covenant faithfulness will be with him; by my name he will be victorious.
I will place his hand over the sea and his right hand over the rivers.
He will call out to me, 'You are my Father, my God, and the rock of my salvation.'
I also will place him as my firstborn son, the most exalted of the kings of the earth.
I will extend my covenant faithfulness to him forever; and my covenant with him will be secure.
I will make his descendants endure forever and his throne as enduring as the skies above.
If his children forsake my law and do not walk in my regulations,
if they break my rules and do not keep my commands,
then will I punish their rebellion with a rod and their iniquity with blows.
But I will not remove my steadfast love from him or be unfaithful to my promise.
I will not break my covenant or change the words of my lips.
Once and for all I have sworn by my holiness— I will not lie to David:
his descendants will continue forever and his throne as long as the sun before me.
It will be established forever like the moon, the faithful witness in the sky.” Selah
But you have refused and rejected; you have been angry with your anointed king.
You have renounced the covenant of your servant. You have desecrated his crown on the ground.
You have broken down all his walls. You have ruined his strongholds.
All who pass by have robbed him. He has become an object of disgust to his neighbors.
You have raised the right hand of his enemies; you have made all his enemies rejoice.
You turn back the edge of his sword and have not made him stand when in battle.
You have brought his splendor to an end; you have brought down his throne to the ground.
You have shortened the days of his youth. You have covered him with shame. Selah
How long, Yahweh? Will you hide yourself, forever? How long will your anger burn like fire?
Oh, think about how short my time is, and for what uselessness you have created all the children of mankind!
Who can live and not die, or rescue his own life from the hand of Sheol? Selah
Lord, where are your former acts of covenant faithfulness that you swore to David in your truthfulness?
Call to mind, Lord, the mocking directed against your servants and how I bear in my heart so many insults from the nations.
Your enemies hurl insults, Yahweh; they mock the footsteps of your anointed one.
Blessed be Yahweh forever. Amen and Amen.

Lord, you have been our refuge throughout all generations.
Before the mountains were formed, or you formed the earth and the world, from everlasting to everlasting, you are God.
You return man to dust, and you say, “Return, you descendants of mankind.”
For a thousand years in your sight are as yesterday when it is past, and as a watch in the night.
You sweep them away as with a flood and they sleep; in the morning they are like the grass that sprouts up.
In the morning it blooms and grows up; in the evening it withers and dries up.
Truly, we are consumed in your anger, and in your wrath we are terrified.
You have set our iniquities before you, our hidden sins in the light of your presence.
Our life passes away under your wrath; our years quickly pass like a sigh.
Our years are seventy, or even eighty if we are healthy; but even our best years are marked by trouble and sorrow. Yes, they pass quickly, and we fly away.
Who knows the intensity of your anger, and your wrath that is equal to the fear of you?
So teach us to consider our life so that we might live wisely.
Turn back, Yahweh! How long will it be? Have pity on your servants.
Satisfy us in the morning with your covenant faithfulness so that we may rejoice and be glad all our days.
Make us glad in proportion to the days you afflicted us and to the years we have experienced trouble.
Let your servants see your work, and let our children see your majesty.
May the favor of the Lord our God be ours; prosper the work of our hands; indeed, prosper the work of our hands.
He who lives in the shelter of the Most High will stay in the shadow of the Almighty.
I will say of Yahweh, “He is my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.”
For he will rescue you from the snare of the hunter and from the deadly plague.
He will cover you with his wings, and under his wings you will find refuge. His trustworthiness is a shield and protection.
You will not be afraid of terror in the night, or of the arrow that flies by day,
or of the plague that roams around in the darkness, or of the disease that comes at noontime.
A thousand may fall at your side and ten thousand at your right hand, but it will not reach you.
You will only observe and see the punishment of the wicked.
For Yahweh is my refuge! Make the Most High your refuge also.
No evil will overtake you; no affliction will come near your home.
For he will direct his angels to protect you, to guard you in all your ways.
They will lift you up with their hand so that you will not hit your foot on a stone.
You will crush lions and adders under your feet; you will trample on young lions and serpents.
Because he is devoted to me, I will rescue him. I will protect him because he is loyal to me.
When he calls to me, I will answer him. I will be with him in trouble; I will give him victory and will honor him.
I will satisfy him with long life and show him my salvation.
It is a good thing to give thanks to Yahweh and to sing praises to your name, Most High,
to proclaim your covenant faithfulness in the morning and your truthfulness every night,
with a harp of ten strings and with the melody of the lyre.
For you, Yahweh, have made me glad through your deeds. I will sing for joy because of the deeds of your hands.
How great are your deeds, Yahweh! Your thoughts are very deep.
A brutish person does not know, nor does a fool understand this:
When the wicked sprout like the grass, and even when all the evildoers thrive, still they are doomed to eternal destruction.
But you, Yahweh, will reign forever.
Indeed, look at your enemies, Yahweh! Indeed, look at your enemies. They will perish! All those who do evil will be scattered.
You have lifted up my horn like the horn of the wild ox; I am anointed with fresh oil.
My eyes have seen the downfall of my enemies; my ears have heard of the doom of my evil foes.
The righteous will flourish like the palm tree; they will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
They are planted in the house of Yahweh; they flourish in the courts of our God.
They bear fruit even when they are old; they stay fresh and green,
to proclaim that Yahweh is just. He is my rock, and there is no unrighteousness in him.

Yahweh reigns; he is robed in majesty; Yahweh has clothed and girded himself with strength. The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved.
Your throne is established from ancient times; you are from everlasting.
The oceans rise, Yahweh; they have lifted up their voice; the oceans' waves crash and roar.
Above the crashing of many waves, the mighty breakers of the sea, Yahweh on high is mighty.
Your solemn commands are very trustworthy; holiness adorns your house, Yahweh, forever.
Yahweh, God who avenges, God who avenges, shine over us.
Rise up, judge of the earth, give to the proud what they deserve.
How long will the wicked, Yahweh, how long will the wicked rejoice?
They pour out their arrogant words; all those who do evil boast.
They crush your people, Yahweh; they afflict the nation that belongs to you.
They kill the widow and foreigner who lives in their country, and they murder the fatherless.
They say, “Yahweh will not see, the God of Jacob does not take notice of it.”
Understand, you stupid people! You fools, when will you ever learn?
He who made the ear, does he not hear? He who formed the eye, does he not see?
He who disciplines the nations, does he not correct? He is the one who gives knowledge to man.
Yahweh knows the thoughts of men, that they are vapor.
Blessed is the one whom you instruct, Yahweh, the one whom you teach from your law.
You give him rest in times of trouble until a pit is dug for the wicked.
For Yahweh will not forsake his people or abandon his inheritance.
For judgment will again be righteous; and all the upright in heart will follow it.
Who will rise up to defend me against the evildoers? Who will stand up for me against the wicked?
Unless Yahweh had been my help, I would soon be lying down in the place of silence.
When I said, “My foot is slipping,” Your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, held me up.
When cares within me are many, your consolations make me happy.
Can a throne of destruction be allied with you, one who creates injustice by statute?
They conspire together to take the life of the righteous and they condemn the innocent to death.
But Yahweh has been my high tower, and my God has been the rock of my refuge.
He will bring on them their own iniquity and will cut them off in their own wickedness. Yahweh our God will cut them off.
Oh come, let us sing to Yahweh; let us sing joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
Let us enter his presence with thanksgiving; let us sing to him with psalms of praise.
For Yahweh is a great God and a great King superior to all gods.
In his hand are the depths of the earth; the heights of the mountains are his.
The sea is his, for he made it, and his hands formed the dry land.
Oh come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before Yahweh, our Creator:
For he is our God, and we are the people of his pasture and the sheep of his hand. Today—oh, that you would hear his voice!
“Do not harden your heart, as at Meribah, or as on the day of Massah in the wilderness,
where your forefathers tested me and tried me, though they had seen my deeds.
For forty years I was angry with that generation and said, 'This is a people whose hearts wander astray; they have not known my ways.'
Therefore I vowed in my anger that they would never enter into my resting place.”
Oh, sing to Yahweh a new song; sing to Yahweh, all the earth.
Sing to Yahweh, bless his name; announce his salvation day after day.
Declare his glory among the nations, his marvelous deeds among all the nations.
For Yahweh is great and is to be praised greatly. He is to be feared above all other gods.
For all the gods of the nations are idols, but it is Yahweh who made the heavens.
Splendor and majesty are in his presence. Strength and beauty are in his sanctuary.
Ascribe to Yahweh, you clans of peoples, ascribe praise to Yahweh for his glory and strength.
Give to Yahweh the glory that his name deserves. Bring an offering and come into his courts.
Bow down to Yahweh in the splendor of holiness; tremble before him, all the earth.
Say among the nations, “Yahweh reigns.” The world also is established; it cannot be shaken. He judges the peoples fairly.
Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; let the sea roar and that which fills it shout with joy.
Let the fields rejoice and all that is in them. Then let all the trees in the forest shout for joy
before Yahweh, for he is coming. He is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with his faithfulness.
Yahweh reigns; let the earth rejoice; let the many coastlands be glad.
Clouds and darkness surround him. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.
Fire goes before him and consumes his adversaries on every side.
His lightning lights up the world; the earth sees and trembles.
The mountains melt like wax before Yahweh, the Lord of the whole earth.
The skies declare his justice, and all the nations see his glory.
All those who worship carved figures will be shamed, those who boast in worthless idols— bow down to him, all you gods!
Zion heard and was glad, and the towns of Judah rejoiced because of your righteous decrees, Yahweh.
For you, Yahweh, are most high above all the earth. You are exalted far above all gods.
You who love Yahweh, hate evil! He protects the lives of his saints, and he takes them out of the hand of the wicked.
Light is sown for the righteous and gladness for those with honest hearts.
Be glad in Yahweh, you righteous; and give thanks when you remember his holiness.
Oh, sing to Yahweh a new song, for he has done marvelous things; his right hand and his holy arm have given him victory.
Yahweh has made known his salvation; he has openly showed his justice to all the nations.
He calls to mind his covenant loyalty and faithfulness for the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth will see the victory of our God.
Shout for joy to Yahweh, all the earth; burst into song, sing for joy, and sing praises.
Sing praises to Yahweh with the harp, with the harp and melodious song.
With trumpets and the sound of the horn, make a joyful noise before the King, Yahweh.
Let the sea shout and everything in it, the world and those who live in it!
Let the rivers clap their hands, and let the mountains shout for joy.
Yahweh is coming to judge the earth; he will judge the world with righteousness and the nations with fairness.
Yahweh reigns; let the nations tremble. He sits enthroned above the cherubim; the earth quakes.
Yahweh is great in Zion; he is exalted above all the nations.
Let them praise your great and awesome name; he is holy.
The king is strong, and he loves justice. You have established fairness; you have done righteousness and justice in Jacob.
Praise Yahweh our God and worship at his footstool. He is holy.
Moses and Aaron were among his priests, and Samuel was among those who called on his name. They called to Yahweh, and he answered them.
He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud. They kept his solemn commands and the statutes that he gave them.
You answered them, Yahweh our God. A forgiving God you were to them, but one who punished their sinful deeds.
Praise Yahweh our God, and worship at his holy hill, for Yahweh our God is holy.
Shout joyfully to Yahweh, all the earth.
Serve Yahweh with gladness; come before his presence with joyful singing.
Know that Yahweh is God; he made us, and we are his. We are his people and the sheep of his pasture.
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving and into his courts with praise. Give thanks to him and bless his name.
For Yahweh is good; his covenant faithfulness endures forever and his truthfulness through all generations.
I will sing of covenant faithfulness and justice; to you, Yahweh, I will sing praises.
I will walk in the way of integrity. Oh, when will you come to me? I will walk with integrity within my house.
I will not put wrongdoing before my eyes; I hate worthless evil; it will not cling to me.
Perverse people will leave me; I am not loyal to evil.
I will destroy whoever secretly slanders his neighbor. I will not tolerate anyone who has a proud demeanor and an arrogant attitude.
I will look to the faithful of the land to sit at my side. Those who walk in the way of integrity may serve me.
Deceitful people will not remain within my house; liars will not be welcome before my eyes.
Morning by morning I will destroy all the wicked from the land; I will remove all evildoers from the city of Yahweh.
Hear my prayer, Yahweh; hear my cry to you.
Do not hide your face from me in my time of trouble. Listen to me. When I call out to you, answer me quickly.
For my days pass away like smoke, and my bones burn like fire.
My heart is crushed, and I am like grass that has withered. I forget to eat any food.
With my continual groaning, I have become very thin.
I am like a pelican of the wilderness; I have become like an owl in the ruins.
I lie awake like a solitary bird, alone on the housetop.
My enemies taunt me all day long; those who mock me use my name in curses.
I eat ashes like bread and mix my drink with tears.
Because of your raging anger, you have lifted me up to throw me down.
My days are like a shadow that fades, and I have withered like grass.
But you, Yahweh, live forever, and your fame is for all generations.
You will rise up and have mercy on Zion. Now is the time to have mercy upon her; the appointed time has come.
For your servants hold her stones dear and feel compassion for the dust of her ruins.
The nations will respect your name, Yahweh, and all the kings of the earth will honor your glory.
Yahweh will rebuild Zion and will appear in his glory.
At that time, he will respond to the prayer of the destitute; he will not reject their prayer.
This will be written for future generations, and a people not yet born will praise Yahweh.
For he has looked down from the holy heights; from heaven Yahweh has viewed the earth,
to hear the groaning of the prisoners, to release those who were condemned to death.
Then men will proclaim the name of Yahweh in Zion and his praise in Jerusalem
when the peoples and kingdoms gather together to serve Yahweh.
He has taken away my strength in the middle of life. He has shortened my days.
I said, “My God, do not take me away in the middle of life; you are here throughout all generations.
In ancient times you set the earth in place; the heavens are the work of your hands.
They will perish, but you will remain; they will all grow old like a garment; like clothing, you will remove them, and they will disappear.
But you are the same, and your years will have no end.
The children of your servants will live on, and their descendants will live in your presence.”

I give praise to Yahweh with all my life, and with all that is within me, I give praise to his holy name.
I give praise to Yahweh with all my life, and I remember all of his good deeds.
He forgives all your sins; he heals all your diseases.
He redeems your life from destruction; he crowns you with covenant faithfulness and acts of tender mercy.
He satisfies your life with good things so that your youth is renewed like the eagle.
Yahweh does what is fair and does acts of justice for all who are oppressed.
He made known his ways to Moses, his deeds to the descendants of Israel.
Yahweh is merciful and gracious; he is patient; he has great covenant loyalty.
He will not always discipline; he is not always angry.
He does not deal with us as our sins deserve or repay us for what our sins demand.
For as the skies are high above the earth, so great is his covenant faithfulness toward those who honor him.
As far as the east is from the west, this is how far he has removed the guilt of our sins from us.
As a father has compassion on his children, so Yahweh has compassion on those who honor him.
For he knows how we are formed; he knows that we are dust.
As for man, his days are like grass; he flourishes like a flower in a field.
The wind blows over it, and it disappears, and no one can even tell where it once grew.
But the covenant faithfulness of Yahweh is from everlasting to everlasting on those who honor him. His righteousness extends to their descendants.
They keep his covenant and remember to obey his instructions.
Yahweh has established his throne in the heavens, and his kingdom rules over everyone.
Give praise to Yahweh, you his angels, you mighty ones who are strong and do his word, and obey the sound of his word.
Give praise to Yahweh, all his hosts, you are his servants who carry out his will.
Give praise to Yahweh, all his creatures, in all the places where he reigns. I will give praise to Yahweh with all my life.
I give praise to Yahweh with all my life, Yahweh my God, you are very magnificent; you are clothed with splendor and majesty.
You cover yourself with light as with a garment; you spread out the heavens like a tent curtain.
You lay the beams of your chambers on the clouds; you make the clouds your chariot; you walk on the wings of the wind.
He makes the winds his messengers, flames of fire his servants.
He laid the foundations of the earth, and it will never be moved.
You covered the earth with water like a garment; the water covered the mountains.
Your rebuke made the waters recede; at the sound of your thunderous voice they fled.
The mountains rose, and the valleys spread out into the places that you had appointed for them.
You have set a boundary for them that they will not cross; they will not cover the earth again.
He made springs flow into the valleys; the streams flow between the mountains.
They supply water for all the animals of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
By the riverbanks the birds build their nests; they sing among the branches.
He waters the mountains from his water chambers in the sky. The earth is filled with the fruit of his labor.
He makes the grass grow for the cattle and plants for man to cultivate so that man may produce food from the earth.
He makes wine to make man happy, oil to make his face shine, and food to sustain his life.
The trees of Yahweh get plenty of rain; the cedars of Lebanon which he planted.
There the birds make their nests. The stork makes the cypress tree her home.
The wild goats live on the high mountains; the mountain heights are a refuge for the hyraxes.
He appointed the moon to mark the seasons; the sun knows its time for setting.
You make the darkness of the night when all the beasts of the forest come out.
The young lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God.
When the sun rises, they retreat and sleep in their dens.
Meanwhile, people go out to their work and labor away until the evening.
Yahweh, how many and varied are your works! With wisdom you made them all; the earth overflows with your works.
Over there is the sea, deep and wide, teeming with innumerable creatures, both small and great.
The ships travel there, and Leviathan is also there, which you formed to play in the sea.
All these look to you to give them their food on time.
When you give to them, they gather; when you open your hand, they are satisfied.
When you hide your face, they are troubled; if you take away their breath, they die and return to dust.
When you send out your Spirit, they are created, and you renew the countryside.
May the glory of Yahweh last forever; may Yahweh enjoy his creation.
He looks down on the earth, and it shakes; he touches the mountains, and they smoke.
I will sing to Yahweh all my life; I will sing praise to my God as long as I live.
May my thoughts be sweet to him; I will rejoice in Yahweh.
May sinners vanish from the earth, and let the wicked be no more. I give praise to Yahweh with all my life. Praise Yahweh.
Give thanks to Yahweh, call on his name; make known his deeds among the nations.
Sing to him, sing praises to him; speak of all his marvelous deeds.
Boast in his holy name; let the heart of those who seek Yahweh rejoice.
Seek Yahweh and his strength; seek his presence continually.
Recall the marvelous things he has done, his miracles and the decrees from his mouth,
you descendants of Abraham his servant, you people of Jacob, his chosen ones.
He is Yahweh, our God. His decrees are on all the earth.
He keeps in mind his covenant forever, the word that he commanded for a thousand generations.
He calls to mind the covenant that he made with Abraham and his oath to Isaac.
This is what he confirmed to Jacob as a statute and to Israel as an everlasting covenant.
He said, “I will give you the land of Canaan as your share of your inheritance.”
He said this when they were only few in number, so very few, and were strangers in the land.
They went from nation to nation and from one kingdom to another.
He did not allow anyone to oppress them; he rebuked kings for their sakes.
He said, “Do not touch my anointed ones, and do not harm my prophets.”
He called for a famine on the land; he cut off the whole supply of bread.
He sent a man ahead of them; Joseph was sold as a servant.
His feet were bound by shackles; on his neck was put an iron collar,
until what he had said came to pass. The word of Yahweh tested him.
The king sent servants to release him; the ruler of the people set him free.
He put him in charge of his house as ruler of all his possessions
to instruct his princes as he wished and to teach his elders wisdom.
Then Israel came into Egypt, and Jacob lived for a time in the land of Ham.
Yahweh made his people fruitful, and made them stronger than their enemies.
He caused their enemies to hate his people, to mistreat his servants.
He sent Moses, his servant, and Aaron, whom he had chosen.
They performed his signs among the Egyptians, his wonders in the land of Ham.
He sent darkness and made that land dark, but its people did not obey his commands.
He turned their water into blood and killed their fish.
Their land swarmed with frogs, even in the rooms of their rulers.
He spoke, and swarms of flies and gnats came throughout their country.
He turned their rain into hail, with fire flaming on their land.
He destroyed their vines and fig trees; he broke the trees of their country.
He spoke, and the locusts came, so many locusts.
The locusts ate up all of the vegetation in their land; They ate up all the crops of the ground.
He killed every firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their strength.
He brought the Israelites out with silver and gold; none of his tribes stumbled on the way.
Egypt was glad when they went away, for the Egyptians were afraid of them.
He spread a cloud for a covering and made a fire to light up the night.
The Israelites asked for food, and he brought quail and satisfied them with bread from heaven.
He split the rock, and waters gushed from it; they flowed in the wilderness like a river.
For he called to mind his holy promise that he made to Abraham his servant.
He led his people out with joy, his chosen with shouts of triumph.
He gave them the lands of the nations; they took possession of the wealth of the peoples
so that they might keep his statutes and obey his laws. Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh. Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Who can recount the mighty acts of Yahweh or proclaim in full all his praiseworthy deeds?
Blessed are those who do what is right, and whose deeds are always just.
Call me to mind, Yahweh, when you show favor to your people; help me when you save them.
Then I will see the prosperity of your chosen, rejoice in the gladness of your nation, and glory with your inheritance.
We have sinned like our ancestors; we have done wrong, and we have done evil.
Our fathers did not appreciate your marvelous deeds in Egypt; they ignored your many acts of covenant faithfulness; they were rebellious at the sea, the Sea of Reeds.
Nevertheless, he saved them for his name's sake so that he might reveal his power.
He rebuked the Sea of Reeds, and it dried up. Then he led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.
He saved them from the hand of those who hated them, and he rescued them from the hand of the enemy.
But the waters covered their adversaries; not one of them survived.
Then they believed his words, and they sang his praise.
But they quickly forgot what he had done; they did not wait for his instructions.
They had insatiable cravings in the wilderness, and they challenged God in the desert.
So he gave them what they requested, but he sent a horrible disease upon them.
In the camp they became jealous of Moses and Aaron, the holy priest of Yahweh.
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and covered the followers of Abiram.
Fire broke out among them; the fire consumed the wicked.
They made a calf at Horeb and worshiped a cast metal figure.
They traded the glory of God for the image of a bull that eats grass.
They forgot God their Savior, who had done great deeds in Egypt.
He had done wonderful things in the land of Ham and mighty acts at the Sea of Reeds.
So he said he would destroy them— had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him, to turn away his anger from destroying them.
Then they despised the fruitful land; they did not believe his promise,
but grumbled in their tents, and did not obey Yahweh.
Therefore he raised his hand and swore to them that he would let them die in the desert,
scatter their descendants among the nations, and scatter them in foreign lands.
They worshiped the Baal of Peor and ate the sacrifices offered to the dead.
They provoked him to anger with their actions, and a plague broke out among them.
Then Phinehas rose to intervene, and the plague subsided.
It was counted to him as a righteous deed to all generations forever.
They also angered Yahweh at the waters of Meribah, and Moses suffered because of them.
They made Moses bitter, and he spoke rashly.
They did not destroy the nations as Yahweh had commanded them,
but they mingled with the nations and learned their ways
and worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them.
They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
They shed innocent blood, the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, desecrating the land with blood.
They were defiled by their deeds; in their actions they were like prostitutes.
So Yahweh was angry with his people, and he despised his own people.
He gave them into the hand of the nations, and those who hated them ruled over them.
Their enemies oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection to their authority.
Many times he came to help them, but they kept rebelling and were brought low by their own sin.
Nevertheless, he paid attention to their distress when he heard their cry for help.
He called to mind his covenant with them and relented because of his steadfast love.
He caused all their conquerers to have pity on them.
Save us, Yahweh, our God. Gather us from among the nations so that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praises.
May Yahweh, the God of Israel, be praised from everlasting to everlasting. All the people said, “Amen.” Praise Yahweh.
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, and his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Let the redeemed of Yahweh speak out, those he has rescued from the hand of the enemy.
He has gathered them out of foreign lands, from the east and from the west, from the north and from the south.
They wandered in the wilderness on a desert road and found no city in which to live.
Because they were hungry and thirsty, they fainted from exhaustion.
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he rescued them out of their distress.
He led them by a direct path so that they would go to a city to live in.
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
For he satisfies the longings of those who are thirsty, and the desires of those who are hungry he fills up with good things.
Some sat in darkness and in gloom, prisoners in affliction and chains.
This was because they had rebelled against God's word and rejected the instruction of the Most High.
He humbled their hearts through hardship; they stumbled and there was no one to help them up.
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.
He brought them out of darkness and gloom and broke their bonds.
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
For he has broken the gates of bronze and cut through the bars of iron.
They were foolish in their rebellious ways and afflicted because of their sins.
They lost their desire to eat any food, and they came close to the gates of death.
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.
He sent his word and healed them, and he rescued them from their destruction.
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
Let them offer the sacrifices of thanksgiving and proclaim his deeds in singing.
Some travel on the sea in ships and do business overseas.
These saw the deeds of Yahweh and his wonders on the seas.
For he commanded and aroused the windstorm that stirs up the seas.
They reached up to the sky; they went down to the depths. Their lives melted away in distress.
They swayed and staggered like drunkards and were at their wits' end.
Then they called out to Yahweh in their trouble, and he brought them out of their distress.
He calmed the storm, and the waves were stilled.
Then they rejoiced because the sea was calm, and he brought them to their desired harbor.
Oh that people would praise Yahweh for his covenant faithfulness and for the amazing things he has done for humanity!
Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the council of the elders.
He turns rivers into a wilderness, springs of water into dry land,
and a fruitful land into a barren place because of the wickedness of its people.
He turns the wilderness into a pool of water and dry land into springs of water.
He settles the hungry there, and they build a city to live in.
They build a city to plant fields in, to plant vineyards, and to bring in an abundant harvest.
He blesses them so they are very numerous. He does not let their cattle decrease in number.
They were diminished and brought low by painful distress and suffering.
He pours contempt on the leaders and causes them to wander in the wilderness, where there are no roads.
But he protects the needy from affliction and cares for his families like a flock.
The upright will see this and rejoice, and all wickedness shuts its mouth.
Whoever is wise should take note of these things and meditate on Yahweh's acts of covenant faithfulness.
My heart is fixed, God; I will sing, yes, I will sing praises also with my honored heart.
Wake up, lute and harp; I will wake up the dawn.
I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the peoples; I will sing praises to you among the nations.
For your covenant faithfulness is great above the heavens; and your trustworthiness reaches to the skies.
Be exalted, God, above the heavens, and may your glory be exalted over all the earth.
So that those you love may be rescued, rescue us with your right hand and answer me.
God has spoken in his holiness; “I will rejoice; I will divide Shechem and apportion out the Valley of Succoth.
Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is my helmet; Judah is my scepter.
Moab is my washbasin; over Edom I will throw my shoe; I will shout in triumph because of Philistia.
Who will bring me into the strong city? Who will lead me to Edom?”
God, have you not rejected us? You do not go into battle with our army.
Give us help against the enemy, for man's help is futile.
We will triumph with God's help; he will trample down our enemies.

God whom I praise, do not be silent,
For the wicked and deceitful attack me; they speak lies against me.
They surround me and say hateful things, and they attack me without cause.
In return for my love they accuse me, but I pray for them.
They repay me evil for good, and they hate my love.
Appoint a wicked man over such an enemy as these people; appoint an accuser to stand at his right hand.
When he is judged, may he be found guilty; may his prayer be considered sinful.
May his days be few; may another take his office.
May his children be fatherless, and may his wife be a widow.
May his children wander about and beg, asking for handouts as they leave their ruined home.
May the creditor take all he owns; may strangers plunder what he earns.
May no one extend any kindness to him; may no one have pity on his fatherless children.
May his children be cut off; may their name be blotted out in the next generation.
May his ancestors' sins be mentioned to Yahweh; and may the sin of his mother not be forgotten.
May their guilt always be before Yahweh; may Yahweh cut off their memory from the earth.
May Yahweh do this because this man never bothered to show any covenant faithfulness, but instead harassed the oppressed, the needy, and the disheartened to death.
He loved cursing; may it come back upon him. He hated blessing; may no blessing come to him.
He clothed himself with cursing as his garment, and his curse came into his inner being like water, like oil into his bones.
May his curses be to him like the clothes he wears to cover himself, like the belt he always wears.
May this be the reward of my accusers from Yahweh, of those who say evil things about me.
Yahweh my Lord, deal kindly with me for your name's sake. Because your covenant faithfulness is good, save me.
For I am oppressed and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
I am fading away like the shadow of the evening; I am shaken off like a locust.
My knees are weak from fasting; I am turning to skin and bones.
I am disdained by my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads.
Help me, Yahweh my God; save me by your covenant faithfulness.
May they know that this is your doing, that you, Yahweh, have done this.
Though they curse me, please bless me; when they attack, may they be put to shame, but may your servant rejoice.
May my adversaries be clothed with shame; may they wear their shame like a robe.
With my mouth I give great thanks to Yahweh; I will praise him in the midst of a crowd.
For he will stand at the right hand of the one who is needy, to save him from those who judge him.
Yahweh says to my master, “Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies your footstool.”
Yahweh will hold out the scepter of your strength from Zion; rule among your enemies.
Your people will follow you in holy garments of their own free will on the day of your power; from the womb of the dawn your youth will be to you like the dew.
Yahweh has sworn, and will not change: “You are a priest forever, after the manner of Melchizedek.”
The Lord is at your right hand. He will kill kings on the day of his anger.
He will judge the nations; he will fill the battlegrounds with dead bodies; he will kill the leaders in many countries.
He will drink of the brook along the road, and then he will lift his head up high after victory.
Praise Yahweh. I will give thanks to Yahweh with my whole heart in the assembly of the upright, in their gathering.
The works of Yahweh are great, eagerly awaited by all those who desire them.
His work is majestic and glorious, and his righteousness endures forever.
He does wonderful things that will be remembered; Yahweh is gracious and merciful.
He gives food to his faithful followers. He will always call to mind his covenant.
He showed his powerful works to his people in giving them the inheritance of the nations.
The works of his hands are trustworthy and just; all his instructions are reliable.
They are established forever, to be observed faithfully and properly.
He gave victory to his people; he ordained his covenant forever; holy and awesome is his name.
To honor Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom; those who carry out his instructions have good understanding. His praise endures forever.
Praise Yahweh. Blessed is the man who obeys Yahweh, who greatly delights in his commandments.
His descendants will be powerful on earth; the descendants of the godly man will be blessed.
Wealth and riches are in his house; his righteousness will endure forever.
Light shines in the darkness for the godly person; he is gracious, merciful, and just.
It goes well for the man who deals graciously and lends money, who conducts his affairs with honesty.
For he will never be moved; the righteous person will be remembered forever.
He does not fear bad news; he is confident, trusting in Yahweh.
His heart is tranquil, without fear, until he looks in triumph over his adversaries.
He generously gives to the poor; his righteousness endures forever; he will be exalted with honor.
The wicked person will see this and be angry; he will grind his teeth in rage and he will melt away; the desire of the wicked people will perish.
Praise Yahweh. Praise him, you servants of Yahweh; praise the name of Yahweh.
Blessed be the name of Yahweh, both now and forevermore.
From the rising of the sun to its setting, Yahweh's name should be praised.
Yahweh is exalted above all nations, and his glory reaches above the skies.
Who is like Yahweh our God, who has his seat on high,
who looks down at the sky and at the earth?
He raises up the poor out of the dirt and lifts up the needy from the ash heap,
so that he may seat him with princes, with the princes of his people.
He gives a home to the barren woman of the house, he makes her a joyful mother of children. Praise Yahweh!
When Israel left Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people who spoke a foreign language,
Judah became his holy place, Israel his kingdom.
The sea looked and fled; the Jordan turned back.
The mountains skipped like rams, the hills skipped like lambs.
Why did you flee, sea? Jordan, why did you turn back?
Mountains, why did you skip like rams? You little hills, why did you skip like lambs?
Tremble, earth, before the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob.
He turned the rock into a pool of water, the hard rock into a spring of water.
Not to us, Yahweh, not to us, but to your name bring honor, for your covenant faithfulness and for your trustworthiness.
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”
Our God is in heaven; he does whatever he pleases.
The nations' idols are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.
Those idols have mouths, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;
they have ears, but they do not hear; they have noses, but they do not smell.
Those idols have hands, but do not feel; they have feet, but they cannot walk; nor do they speak from their mouths.
Those who make them are like them, as is everyone who trusts in them.
Israel, trust in Yahweh; he is your help and shield.
House of Aaron, trust in Yahweh; he is your help and shield.
You who honor Yahweh, trust in him; he is your help and shield.
Yahweh takes notice of us and will bless us; he will bless the family of Israel; he will bless the family of Aaron.
He will bless those who honor him, both young and old.
May Yahweh increase your numbers more and more, yours and your descendants'.
May you be blessed by Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.
The heavens belong to Yahweh; but the earth he has given to mankind.
The dead do not praise Yahweh, nor do any who go down into silence;
But we will bless Yahweh now and forevermore. Praise Yahweh.
I love Yahweh because he hears my voice and my pleas for mercy.
Because he listened to me, I will call on him as long as I live.
The cords of death surrounded me, and the snares of Sheol confronted me; I felt anguish and sorrow.
Then I called on the name of Yahweh: “Please Yahweh, rescue my life.”
Yahweh is merciful and fair; our God is compassionate.
Yahweh protects the naive; I was brought low, and he saved me.
My soul can return to its resting place, for Yahweh has been good to me.
For you rescued my life from death, my eyes from tears, and my feet from stumbling.
I will serve Yahweh in the land of the living.
I believed in him, even when I said, “I am greatly afflicted.”
In my confusion I said, “All men are liars.”
How can I repay Yahweh for all his kindnesses to me?
I will raise the cup of salvation, and call on the name of Yahweh.
I will fulfill my vows to Yahweh in the presence of all his people.
Precious in the sight of Yahweh is the death of his saints.
Yahweh, indeed, I am your servant; I am your servant, the son of your servant woman; you have taken away my bonds.
I will offer to you the sacrifice of thanksgiving and will call on the name of Yahweh.
I will fulfill my vows to Yahweh in the presence of all his people,
in the courts of Yahweh's house, in your midst, Jerusalem. Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh, all you nations; exalt him, all you peoples.
For his covenant faithfulness is great toward us, and the trustworthiness of Yahweh endures forever. Praise Yahweh.
Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Let Israel say, “His covenant faithfulness endures forever.”
Let the house of Aaron say, “His covenant faithfulness endures forever.”
Let the loyal followers of Yahweh say, “His covenant faithfulness endures for ever.”
In my distress I called out to Yahweh; Yahweh answered me and set me free.
Yahweh is with me; I will not be afraid; what can man do to me?
Yahweh is on my side as my helper; I will look in triumph on those who hate me.
It is better to take shelter in Yahweh than to put confidence in man.
It is better to take refuge in Yahweh than to put one's trust in a princes.
All the nations surrounded me; in Yahweh's name I cut them off.
They surrounded me; yes, they surrounded me; in Yahweh's name I cut them off.
They surrounded me like bees; they disappeared as quickly as fire among thorns; in Yahweh's name I cut them off.
They attacked me to knock me down, but Yahweh helped me.
Yahweh is my strength and joy, and he is the one who rescues me.
The joyful shout of victory is heard in the tents of the righteous; the right hand of Yahweh conquers.
The right hand of Yahweh is exalted; the right hand of Yahweh conquers.
I will not die, but live and declare the deeds of Yahweh.
Yahweh has punished me harshly; but he has not handed me over to death.
Open to me the gates of righteousness; I will enter them and I will give thanks to Yahweh.
This is the gate of Yahweh; the righteous enter through it.
I will give thanks to you, for you answered me, and you have become my salvation.
The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
This is Yahweh's doing; it is marvelous in our eyes.
This is the day on which Yahweh has acted; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
Please, Yahweh, give us victory! Please, Yahweh, give us success!
Blessed is he who comes in the name of Yahweh; we bless you from the house of Yahweh.
Yahweh is God, and he has given us light; bind the sacrifice with cords to the horns of the altar.
You are my God, and I will give thanks to you; you are my God; I will exalt you.
Oh, give thanks to Yahweh; for he is good; for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Blessed are those whose ways are blameless, who walk in the law of Yahweh.
Blessed are they who keep his solemn commands, who seek him with all their heart.
They do no wrong; they walk in his ways.
You have commanded us to keep your instructions so that we should carefully observe them.
Oh, that I would be firmly established in the observance of your statutes!
Then I would not be put to shame when I think of all your commandments.
I will give thanks to you with an upright heart when I learn your righteous decrees.
I will observe your statutes; do not leave me alone.
How can a young person keep his path pure? By obeying your word.
With my whole heart I seek you; Do not let me stray from your commandments.
I have stored up your word in my heart so that I might not sin against you.
Blessed you are, Yahweh; teach me your statutes.
With my mouth I have declared all the righteous decrees that you have revealed.
I rejoice in the way of your covenant decrees more than in all riches.
I will meditate on your instructions and pay attention to your ways.
I delight in your statutes; I will not forget your word.
Be kind to your servant so that I may live and keep your word.
Open my eyes so that I may see marvelous things in your law.
I am a foreigner in the land; do not hide your commandments from me.
My desires are crushed by the longing to know your righteous decrees at all times.
You rebuke the proud, who are cursed, who wander from your commandments.
Spare me from disgrace and humiliation, for I have obeyed your covenant decrees.
Though rulers plot and slander me, your servant meditates on your statutes.
Your covenant decrees are my delight, and they are my counselors.
My life clings to the dust! Give me life by your word.
I told you my ways, and you answered me; teach me your statutes.
Make me understand the ways of your instructions, so that I can meditate on your wondrous teachings.
I am overwhelmed with grief! Strengthen me by your word.
Turn from me the path of deceit; graciously teach me your law.
I have chosen the way of faithfulness; I have always kept your righteous decrees before me.
I cling to your covenant decrees; Yahweh, do not let me be shamed.
I will run in the path of your commandments, for you enlarge my heart to do so.
Teach me, Yahweh, the way of your statutes, and I will keep them to the end.
Give me understanding, and I will keep your law; I will observe it with all my heart.
Guide me in the path of your commandments, for I delight to walk in it.
Direct my heart toward your covenant decrees and away from unrighteous gain.
Turn my eyes from looking at worthless things; revive me in your ways.
Carry out for your servant your promise that you made to those who honor you.
Take away the insults I dread, for your righteous judgments are good.
See, I have longed for your instructions; revive me in your righteousness.
Yahweh, give me your unfailing love— your salvation, according to your promise;
then I will have a reply for the one who mocks me, for I trust in your word.
Do not take the word of truth from my mouth, for my hope is in your righteous decrees.
I will observe your law continually, forever and ever.
I will walk securely, for I seek your instructions.
I will speak of your solemn commands before kings and will not be ashamed.
I delight in your commandments, which I love dearly.
I will lift up my hands to your commandments, which I love; I will meditate on your statutes.
Call to mind your promise to your servant because you have given me hope.
This is my comfort in my affliction: that your promise has kept me alive.
The proud have scoffed at me, yet I have not turned away from your law.
I have thought about your righteous decrees from ancient times, Yahweh, and I comfort myself.
Hot anger has taken hold of me because of the wicked who reject your law.
Your statutes have been my songs in the house where I temporarily live.
I think about your name during the night, Yahweh, and I keep your law.
This has been my practice because I have observed your instructions.
Yahweh is my portion; I have determined to observe your words.
I earnestly request your favor with my whole heart; be merciful to me, as your word promised.
I examined my ways and turned my feet to your covenant decrees.
I hurry and do not delay to keep your commandments.
The cords of the wicked have ensnared me; I have not forgotten your law.
At midnight I rise to give thanks to you because of your righteous decrees.
I am a companion of all who honor you, to all who observe your instructions.
The earth, Yahweh, is full of your covenant faithfulness; teach me your statutes.
You have done good to your servant, Yahweh, by means of your word.
Teach me proper discernment and understanding, for I have believed in your commandments.
Before I was afflicted I went astray, but now I observe your word.
You are good, and you are one who does good; teach me your statutes.
The arrogant have smeared me with lies, but I keep your instructions with my whole heart.
Their hearts are hardened, but I delight in your law.
It is good for me that I have suffered so that I would learn your statutes.
Instruction from your mouth is more precious to me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.
Your hands have made and fashioned me; give me understanding so that I may learn your commandments.
Those who honor you will be glad when they see me because I find hope in your word.
I know, Yahweh, that your decrees are just, and that in faithfulness you afflicted me.
Let your covenant faithfulness comfort me, as you promised your servant.
Show me compassion so that I may live, for your law is my delight.
Let the proud be put to shame, for they have slandered me; but I will meditate on your instructions.
May those who honor you turn to me, those who know your covenant decrees.
May my heart be blameless with respect to your statutes so that I may not be put to shame.
I faint with longing that you might rescue me! I hope in your word.
My eyes long to see your promise; when will you comfort me?
For I have become like a wineskin in the smoke; I do not forget your statutes.
How long must your servant endure this; when will you judge those who persecute me?
The proud have dug pits for me, defying your law.
All your commandments are reliable; those people persecute me wrongfully; help me.
They have almost made an end to me on earth, but I do not reject your instructions.
By your steadfast love, keep me alive, so that I may obey your commands.
Yahweh, your word stands forever; your word is established firmly in heaven.
Your faithfulness lasts for all generations; you have established the earth, and it remains.
All things continue to this day, just as you said in your righteous decrees, for all things are your servants.
If your law had not been my delight, I would have perished in my affliction.
I will never forget your instructions, for through them you have kept me alive.
I am yours; save me, for I seek your instructions.
The wicked prepare to destroy me, but I will seek to understand your covenant decrees.
I have seen that everything has its limits, but your commandments are broad, beyond limits.
Oh how I love your law! It is my meditation all day long.
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, for your commandments are always with me.
I have more understanding than all my teachers, for I meditate on your covenant decrees.
I understand more than those older than I am; this is because I have kept your instructions.
I have kept my feet back from every evil path so that I might observe your word.
I have not turned aside from your righteous decrees, for you have instructed me.
How sweet are your words to my taste, yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
Through your instructions I gain discernment; therefore I hate every false way.
Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light for my path.
I have sworn and have confirmed it, that I will observe your righteous decrees.
I am very afflicted; keep me alive, Yahweh, as you have promised in your word.
Yahweh, please accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, and teach me your righteous decrees.
My life is always in my hand, yet I do not forget your law.
The wicked have set a snare for me, but I have not strayed from your instructions.
I claim your covenant decrees as my heritage forever, for they are the joy of my heart.
My heart is set on obeying your statutes forever to the very end.
I hate those who have a double mind, but I love your law.
You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.
Get away from me, you evil doers, so that I may observe the commandments of my God.
Sustain me by your word so that I may live and not be ashamed of my hope.
Support me, and I will be safe; I will always meditate on your statutes.
You reject all those who stray from your statutes, for those people are deceptive and unreliable.
You remove all the wicked of the earth like slag; therefore I love your solemn commands.
My body trembles in fear of you, and I am afraid of your righteous decrees.
I do what is just and right; do not abandon me to my oppressors.
Guarantee the welfare of your servant; do not let the proud oppress me.
My eyes grow tired as I wait for your salvation and for your righteous word.
Show your servant your covenant faithfulness, and teach me your statutes.
I am your servant; give me understanding so that I may know your covenant decrees.
It is time for Yahweh to act, for people have broken your law.
Truly I love your commandments more than gold, more than fine gold.
Therefore I carefully follow all your instructions, and I hate every path of falsehood.
Your rules are wonderful, that is why I obey them.
The unfolding of your words gives light; it gives understanding to the untrained.
I open my mouth and pant, for I long for your commandments.
Turn to me and have mercy on me, as you always do for those who love your name.
Direct my footsteps by your word; do not let any sin rule me.
Redeem me from human oppression so that I may observe your instructions.
Let your face shine on your servant, and teach me your statutes.
Streams of tears run down from my eyes because people do not observe your law.
You are righteous, Yahweh, and your decrees are fair.
You have given your covenant decrees righteously and faithfully.
Anger has destroyed me because my adversaries forget your words.
Your word has been tested very much, and your servant loves it.
I am insignificant and despised, yet I do not forget your instructions.
Your justice is forever right, and your law is trustworthy.
Though distress and anguish have found me, your commandments are still my delight.
Your covenant decrees are righteous forever; give me understanding that I may live.
I cried out with my whole heart, “Answer me, Yahweh, I will keep your statutes.
I call to you; save me, and I will observe your covenant decrees.”
I rise before the dawn of the morning and cry for help. I hope in your words.
My eyes are open before the night watches change so that I might meditate on your word.
Hear my voice in your covenant faithfulness; keep me alive, Yahweh, as you have promised in your righteous decrees.
Those who are persecuting me are coming closer to me, but they are far from your law.
