You are near, Yahweh, and all your commandments are trustworthy.
Long ago I learned from your covenant decrees that you had set them in place forever.
Look on my affliction and help me, for I do not forget your law.
Plead my cause and redeem me; keep me, as you have promised in your word.
Salvation is far from the wicked, for they do not love your statutes.
Great are your merciful actions, Yahweh; keep me alive, as you always do.
My persecutors and my foes are many, yet I have not turned from your covenant decrees.
I view the treacherous with disgust because they do not keep your word.
See how I love your instructions; keep me alive, Yahweh, as you have promised by your covenant faithfulness.
The essence of your word is truth; every one of your righteous decrees lasts forever.
Princes persecute me without cause, but my heart stands in awe of your word.
I rejoice at your word like one who finds great plunder.
I hate and despise falsehood, but I love your law.
Seven times a day I praise you because of your righteous decrees.
Great peace they have, those who love your law; nothing makes them stumble.
I hope for your salvation, Yahweh, and I obey your commandments.
I observe your solemn commands, and I love them greatly.
I keep your instructions and your solemn commands, for you are aware of everything I do.
Listen to my cry for help, Yahweh; give me understanding into your word.
May my plea come before you; help me, as you have promised in your word.
May my lips pour out praise, for you teach me your statutes.
Let my tongue sing about your word, for all your commandments are right.
May your hand help me, for I have chosen your instructions.
I long for your rescue, Yahweh, and your law is my delight.
May I live and praise you, and may your righteous decrees help me.
I have wandered off like a lost sheep; seek your servant, for I have not forgotten your commandments.
In my distress I called out to Yahweh, and he answered me.
Rescue my life, Yahweh, from those who lie with their lips and deceive with their tongues.
How will he punish you, and what more will he do to you, you who have a lying tongue?
He will punish you with the arrows of a warrior sharpened over burning coals of the broom tree.
Woe is me because I temporarily live in Meshech; I lived previously among the tents of Kedar.
For too long I have lived with those who hate peace.
I am for peace, but when I speak, they are for war.
I will lift up my eyes to the mountains. From where will my help come?
My help comes from Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.
He will not allow your foot to slip; he who protects you will not slumber.
See, the guardian of Israel never slumbers or sleeps.
Yahweh is your guardian; Yahweh is the shade at your right hand.
The sun will not harm you by day, nor the moon by night.
Yahweh will protect you from all harm, and he will protect your life.
Yahweh will protect you in all you do now and forevermore.
I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of Yahweh.”
Jerusalem, our feet are standing within your gates!
Jerusalem, built as a city carefully planned!
The tribes go up to Jerusalem—the tribes of Yahweh— as a testimony for Israel, to give thanks to the name of Yahweh.
There thrones of judgment were set, thrones of the house of David.
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem! “May those who love you have peace.
May there be peace within the walls that defend you, and may they have peace within your fortresses.”
For the sake of my brothers and my friends I will say, “May there be peace within you.”
For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God, I will seek good for you.
To you I lift up my eyes, you who are enthroned in the heavens.
See, as the eyes of servants look to their master's hand, as the eyes of a maid look to her mistress's hand, so our eyes look to Yahweh our God until he has mercy on us.
Have mercy on us, Yahweh, have mercy on us, for we are filled with humiliation.
We are more than full of the scoffing of the insolent and with the contempt of the proud.
“If Yahweh had not been on our side,” let Israel say now,
“if it had not been Yahweh who was on our side when men rose up against us,
then they would have swallowed us up alive when their anger raged against us.
The water would have swept us away; the torrent would have overwhelmed us.
Then the raging waters would have drowned us.”
Blessed be Yahweh, who has not allowed us to be torn by their teeth.
We have escaped like a bird out of the snare of the fowlers; the snare has been broken, and we have escaped.
Our help is in Yahweh, who made heaven and earth.
Those who trust in Yahweh are like Mount Zion, unshakable, forever enduring.
As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so Yahweh surrounds his people now and forever.
The scepter of wickedness must not rule in the land of the righteous. Otherwise the righteous might do what is wrong.
Do good, Yahweh, to those who are good and to those who are upright in their hearts.
But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways, Yahweh will lead them away with the evildoers. May peace be on Israel.
When Yahweh restored the fortunes of Zion, we were like those who dream.
Then our mouths were filled with laughter and our tongues with singing. Then they said among the nations, “Yahweh has done great things for them.”
Yahweh did great things for us; how glad we were!
Restore our fortunes, Yahweh, like the streams in the Negev.
Those who sow in tears will reap with shouts of joy.
He who goes out weeping, carrying seed for sowing, will return again with shouts of joy, bringing his bundles of grain with him.
Unless Yahweh builds the house, they work uselessly, those who build it. Unless Yahweh guards the city, the watchman stands guard uselessly.
It is useless for you to rise up early, to come home late, or to eat the bread of hard work, for Yahweh provides for his beloved as they sleep.
See, children are a heritage from Yahweh, and the fruit of the womb is a reward from him.
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, so are the children of one's youth.
How blessed is the man that has his quiver full of them. He will not be put to shame when he confronts his enemies in the gate.
Blessed is everyone who honors Yahweh, who walks in his ways.
What your hands provide, you will enjoy; you will be blessed and prosper.
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in your house; your children will be like olive plants as they sit around your table.
Yes, indeed, the man will be blessed who honors Yahweh.
May Yahweh bless you from Zion; may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
May you live to see your children's children. May peace be on Israel.
“Often since my youth they have attacked me,” let Israel say.
“Often since my youth they have attacked me, yet they have not defeated me.
The plowers plowed on my back; they made their furrows long.
Yahweh is righteous; he has cut the ropes of the wicked.”
May they all be put to shame and turned back, those who hate Zion.
May they be like the grass on the housetops that withers before it grows up,
that cannot fill the reaper's hand or the chest of the one who binds bundles of grain together.
May those who pass by not say, “May the blessing of Yahweh be on you; we bless you in the name of Yahweh.”
Out of the depths I cry to you, Yahweh.
Lord, hear my voice; let your ears be attentive to my pleas for mercy.
If you, Yahweh, would mark iniquities, Lord, who could stand?
But there is forgiveness with you, that you may be revered.
I wait for Yahweh, my soul waits, and in his word I hope.
My soul waits for the Lord more than watchmen wait for the morning.
Israel, hope in Yahweh. Yahweh is merciful, and he is very willing to forgive.
It is he who will redeem Israel from all his sins.
Yahweh, my heart is not proud or my eyes haughty. I do not have great hopes for myself or concern myself with things that are beyond me.
Indeed I have stilled and quieted my soul; like a weaned child with his mother, my soul within me is like a weaned child.
Israel, hope in Yahweh now and forever.
Yahweh, for David's sake call to mind all his afflictions.
Call to mind how he swore to Yahweh, how he vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob.
He said, “I will not enter my house or get into my bed,
I will not give sleep to my eyes or rest to my eyelids
until I find a place for Yahweh, a tabernacle for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
See, we heard about it in Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of Jaar.
We will go into God's tabernacle; we will worship at his footstool.
Arise, Yahweh, to your resting place, you and the ark of your strength!
May your priests be clothed with integrity; may your faithful ones shout for joy.
For your servant David's sake, do not turn away from your anointed king.
Yahweh swore a sure oath to David, a sure oath that he will not revoke: “I will place one of your descendants on your throne.
If your sons keep my covenant and the laws that I will teach them, their children also will sit on your throne forevermore.”
Certainly Yahweh has chosen Zion, he has desired her for his seat.
“This is my resting place forever. I will live here, for I desire her.
I will abundantly bless her with provisions. I will satisfy her poor with bread.
I will clothe her priests with salvation, her faithful ones will shout aloud for joy.
There I will make a horn to sprout for David and set up a lamp for my anointed one.
I will clothe his enemies with shame, but on him his crown will shine.”
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brothers to live together!
It is like fine oil on the head pouring down on the beard— Aaron's beard, and then it pours down on the collar of his robes.
It is like the dew of Hermon which falls on the mountains of Zion. For there Yahweh commanded the blessing— life forevermore.
Come, bless Yahweh, all you servants of Yahweh, you who serve during the night in Yahweh's house.
Lift up your hands to the holy place and bless Yahweh.
May Yahweh bless you from Zion, he who made heaven and earth.
Praise Yahweh. Praise the name of Yahweh. Praise him, you servants of Yahweh,
you who stand in Yahweh's house, in the courtyards of the house of our God.
Praise Yahweh, for he is good; sing praises to his name, for it is pleasant to do so.
For Yahweh has chosen Jacob for himself, Israel as his possession.
I know that Yahweh is great, that our Lord is above all gods.
Whatever Yahweh desires, he does in heaven, on earth, in the seas and all the ocean depths.
He brings the clouds from far away, making lightning bolts accompany the rain and bringing the wind out of his storehouse.
He killed the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and animals.
He sent signs and wonders into your midst, Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
He attacked many nations and killed mighty kings,
Sihon king of the Amorites and Og king of Bashan and all the kingdoms of Canaan.
He gave us their land as an inheritance, an inheritance to Israel his people.
Your name, Yahweh, endures forever; your renown, Yahweh, endures throughout all generations.
For Yahweh defends his people and has compassion on his servants.
The nations' idols are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.
Those idols have mouths, but they do not speak; they have eyes, but they do not see;
they have ears, but they do not hear, nor is there breath in their mouths.
Those who make them are like them, as is everyone who trusts in them.
Descendants of Israel, bless Yahweh; descendants of Aaron, bless Yahweh.
Descendants of Levi, bless Yahweh; you who honor Yahweh, bless Yahweh.
Blessed be Yahweh in Zion, he who lives in Jerusalem. Praise Yahweh.
Oh, give thanks to Yahweh; for he is good, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Oh, give thanks to the God of gods, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Oh, give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who alone does great wonders, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
to him who by wisdom made the heavens, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who spread out the earth above the waters, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
to him who made great lights, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thank to him who gave the sun to rule by day, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
the moon and stars to rule by night, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who killed the firstborn of Egypt, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
and brought out Israel from among them, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
with a strong hand and a raised arm, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who divided the Sea of Reeds, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
and made Israel to pass through the middle of it, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
but overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Sea of Reeds, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who led his people through the wilderness, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
to him who killed great kings, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who killed famous kings, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
Sihon king of the Amorites, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
and Og king of Bashan, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who gave their land as an inheritance, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
an inheritance to Israel his servant, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
to him who called us to mind and helped us in our humiliation, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Give thanks to him who has given us victory over our enemies, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever—
who gives food to all living beings, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
Oh, give thanks to the God of heaven, for his covenant faithfulness endures forever.
By the rivers of Babylon we sat down and wept when we thought about Zion.
On the poplars there we hung our harps.
There our captors required songs from us, and those who mocked us required us to be happy, saying, “Sing us one of the songs of Zion.”
How could we sing a song about Yahweh in a foreign land?
If I ignore the memory of you, Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her skill.
Let my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth if I think about you no more, if I do not prefer Jerusalem more than my greatest delights.
Call to mind, Yahweh, what the Edomites did on the day Jerusalem fell. They said, “Tear it down, tear it down to its foundations.”
Daughter of Babylon, soon to be destroyed— may the person be blessed, whoever pays you back for what you have done to us.
May the person be blessed, whoever takes and dashes your little ones against a rock.
I will give you thanks with my whole heart; before the gods I will sing praises to you.
I will bow down toward your holy temple and give thanks to your name for your covenant faithfulness and for your trustworthiness. You have made your word and your name more important than anything else.
On the day that I called you, you answered me; you made me bold and strengthened my soul.
All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, Yahweh, for they will hear the words from your mouth.
Indeed, they will sing of the deeds of Yahweh, for great is the glory of Yahweh.
For though Yahweh is high, yet he cares for the lowly, but the proud he knows from far off.
Though I walk in the middle of danger, you will preserve my life; you will reach out with your hand against the anger of my enemies, and your right hand will save me.
Yahweh is with me to the end; your covenant faithfulness, Yahweh, endures forever. Do not forsake the ones whom your hands have made.
Yahweh, you have examined me, and you know me.
You know when I sit down and when I get up; you understand my thoughts from far away.
You observe my path and my lying down; you are familiar with all my ways.
For before there is a word on my tongue, you know it completely, Yahweh.
Behind me and before me you surround me and place your hand upon me.
Such knowledge is too much for me; it is too high, and I cannot reach it.
Where can I go from your Spirit? Where can I flee from your presence?
If I ascend up to the heavens, you are there; if I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there.
If I fly away on the wings of the morning and go to live in the uttermost parts across the sea,
even there your hand will lead me, your right hand will hold on to me.
If I said, “Surely the darkness will cover me, and the light will become night around me,”
even the darkness would not be dark to you. The night would shine like the day, for the darkness and the light are both alike to you.
You formed my inner parts; you formed me in my mother's womb.
I will praise you, for I am wonderfully made. My soul knows this very well.
My bones were not hidden from you when I was made in private, when I was intricately made in the depths of the earth.
You saw me inside the womb; all the days assigned to me were recorded in your book even before the first one happened.
How precious are your thoughts to me, God! How vast is their sum!
If I tried to count them, they would be more in number than the sand. When I awake, I am still with you.
If only you would kill the wicked, God; get away from me, you violent men.
They rebel against you and act deceitfully; your enemies tell lies.
Do I not hate those, Yahweh, who hate you? Do I not despise those who rise up against you?
I hate them completely; they have become my enemies.
Examine me, God, and know my heart; test me and know my thoughts.
See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the everlasting way.
Yahweh, rescue me from the wicked; preserve me from violent men.
They plan evil in their hearts; they cause battles every day.
Their tongues wound like serpents; vipers' poison is on their lips. Selah
Keep me from the hands of the wicked, Yahweh; preserve me from violent men who plan to knock me over.
The proud have set a trap for me; they have spread a net; they have set a snare for me. Selah
I said to Yahweh, “You are my God; listen to my cries for mercy.”
Yahweh, my Lord, you are powerfully able to save me; you shield my head in the day of battle.
Yahweh, do not grant the desires of the wicked; do not let their plots succeed. Selah
Those who surround me raise their heads; let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
Let burning coals fall on them; throw them into the fire, into bottomless pits, never more to rise.
May men of tongues not be made secure on the earth; may evil hunt down the violent man to strike him dead.
I know that Yahweh will judge in favor of the afflicted, and that he will give justice to the needy.
Surely the righteous people will give thanks to your name; the upright people will live in your presence.

Yahweh, I am crying out to you; come quickly to me. Listen to me when I call to you.
May my prayer be like incense before you; may my lifted hands be like the evening sacrifice.
Yahweh, place a guard over my mouth; guard the door of my lips.
Do not let my heart desire any evil thing or participate in sinful activities with men who behave wickedly. May I not eat any of their delicacies.
Let a righteous man hit me; it will be a kindness to me. Let him correct me; it will be like oil on my head; may my head not refuse to accept it. But my prayer is always against their wicked deeds.
Their leaders will be thrown down from the top of cliffs; they will hear that my own words are pleasant.
They will have to say, “As when one plows and breaks up the ground, so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.”
Surely my eyes are on you, Yahweh, Lord; in you I take refuge; do not leave my soul defenseless.
Protect me from the snares that they have laid for me, from the traps of evildoers.
Let the wicked fall into their own nets while I escape.
With my voice I cry out for help to Yahweh; with my voice I plead for Yahweh's favor.
I pour out my lament before him; I tell him my troubles.
When my spirit is weak within me, you know my path. In the way that I walk they have hidden a trap for me.
I look to my right and and see that there is no one who cares about me. There is no escape for me; no one cares about my life.
I called out to you, Yahweh; I said, “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.
Listen to my call, for I have been brought very low; rescue me from my persecutors, for they are stronger than I.
Bring my soul out of prison so that I may give thanks to your name. The righteous will gather around me because you have been good to me.”

Hear my prayer, Yahweh; listen to my pleas. Because of your faithfulness and righteousness, answer me!
Do not enter into judgment with your servant, for in your sight no one is righteous.
The enemy has pursued my soul; he has crushed me to the ground; he has made me to live in darkness like those who have been dead a long time.
My spirit is overwhelmed within me; my heart despairs.
I call to mind the old days; I meditate on all your deeds; I reflect on your accomplishments.
I spread my hands out to you; my soul thirsts for you in a parched land. Selah
Answer me quickly, Yahweh, because my spirit faints. Do not hide your face from me, or I will become like those who go down into the pit.
Let me hear your covenant faithfulness in the morning, for I trust in you. Show me the way where I should walk, for I lift up my soul to you.
Rescue me from my enemies, Yahweh; I flee to you to hide.
Teach me to do your will, for you are my God. May your good Spirit lead me in the land of uprightness.
Yahweh, for your name's sake, keep me alive; in your righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
In your covenant faithfulness cut off my enemies and destroy all the enemies of my life, for I am your servant.
Blessed be Yahweh, my rock, who trains my hands for war and my fingers for battle.
You are my covenant faithfulness and my fortress, my high tower and the one who rescues me, my shield and the one in whom I take refuge, the one who subdues nations under me.
Yahweh, what is man that you take notice of him or the son of man that you think about him?
Man is like a breath; his days are like a passing shadow.
Cause the sky to sink and come down, Yahweh; touch the mountains and make them smoke.
Send flashes of lightning and scatter my enemies; shoot your arrows and drive them back in confusion.
Reach out your hand from above; rescue me out of many waters, from the hand of foreigners.
Their mouths speak lies, and their right hand is falsehood.
I will sing a new song to you, God; on a lute of ten strings I will sing praises to you,
who give salvation to kings, who rescued David your servant from an evil sword.
Rescue me and free me from the hand of foreigners. Their mouths speak lies, and their right hand is falsehood.
May our sons be like plants who grow to full size in their youth and our daughters like carved corner pillars, shapely like those of a palace.
May our storehouses be full with every kind of produce, and may our sheep produce thousands and ten thousands in our fields.
Then our oxen will have many young. No one will break through our walls; there will be no exile and no outcry in our streets.
Blessed is the people with such blessings; happy is the people whose God is Yahweh.
I will extol you, my God, King; I will bless your name forever and ever.
Every day will I bless you; I will praise your name forever and ever.
Great is Yahweh and greatly to be praised; his greatness is unsearchable.
One generation will praise your deeds to the next and will proclaim your mighty actions.
I will meditate on the majesty of your glory and on your marvelous deeds.
They will speak of the power of your awesome works, and I will declare your greatness.
They will declare your abounding goodness, and they will sing about your righteousness.
Yahweh is gracious and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in covenant faithfulness.
Yahweh is good to all; his tender mercies are over all his works.
All you have made will give thanks to you, Yahweh; your faithful ones will bless you.
Your faithful ones will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and they will tell of your power.
They will make known to mankind God's mighty deeds and the glorious splendor of his kingdom.
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and your dominion endures throughout all generations.
Yahweh supports all who are falling and raises up all those who are bent over.
The eyes of all wait for you; you give them their food at the right time.
You open your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
Yahweh is righteous in all his ways and gracious in all he does.
Yahweh is near to all those who call to him, to all who call to him in trustworthiness.
He fulfills the desire of those who honor him; he hears their cry and saves them.
Yahweh watches over all those who love him, but he will destroy all the wicked.
My mouth will speak out the praise of Yahweh; let all mankind bless his holy name forever and ever.
Praise Yahweh. Praise Yahweh, my soul.
I give praise to Yahweh with all my life; I will sing praises to my God as long as I exist.
Do not put your trust in princes or in mankind, in whom there is no salvation.
When a person's life's breath stops, he returns to the ground; on that day his plans end.
Blessed is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in Yahweh his God.
Yahweh made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them; he observes trustworthiness forever.
He executes justice for the oppressed and gives food to the hungry. Yahweh frees the prisoners;
Yahweh opens the eyes of the blind; Yahweh raises up those who are bowed down; Yahweh loves the righteous people.
Yahweh protects the foreigners in the land; he lifts up the fatherless and widow, but he opposes the wicked.
Yahweh will reign forever, your God, Zion, for all generations. Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh, for it is good to sing praises to our God, it is pleasant, and praise is suitable.
Yahweh rebuilds Jerusalem, he gathers together the scattered people of Israel.
He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.
He counts the stars, he gives names to all of them.
Great is our Lord and awesome in power, his understanding cannot be measured.
Yahweh lifts up the oppressed, he brings the wicked down to the ground.
Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving, sing praises to our God with a harp.
He covers the heavens with clouds and prepares rain for the earth, making the grass to grow on the mountains.
He gives food to the animals and to the young ravens when they cry.
He finds no delight in the strength of a horse, he takes no pleasure in the strong legs of a man.
Yahweh takes pleasure in those who honor him, who hope in his covenant faithfulness.
Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem, praise your God, Zion.
For he strengthens the bars of your gates, he blesses your children among you.
He brings prosperity inside your borders, he satisfies you with the finest of wheat.
He sends out his commandment to earth, his command runs very swiftly.
He makes the snow like wool, he scatters the frost like ashes.
He dispenses the hail like crumbs, who can withstand the cold he sends?
He sends out his command and melts them, he makes the wind to blow and the water to flow.
He proclaimed his word to Jacob, his statutes and his righteous decrees to Israel.
He has not done so with any other nation, and as for his decrees, they do not know them. Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh. Praise Yahweh, you in the heavens; praise him, you in the heights.
Praise him, all his angels; praise him, all his hosts.
Praise him, sun and moon; praise him, all you shining stars.
Praise him, highest heaven and you waters that are above the sky.
Let them praise the name of Yahweh, for he gave the command, and they were created.
He has also established them forever and ever; he issued a decree that will never change.
Praise him from the earth, you sea monsters and all ocean depths,
fire and hail, snow and clouds, stormy wind fulfilling his word.
Praise him, mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,
animals wild and tame, creatures that crawl and birds.
Praise Yahweh, kings of the earth and all nations, princes and all who govern on the earth,
both young men and young women, elderly and children.
Let them all praise the name of Yahweh, for his name alone is exalted and his glory extends over the earth and the heavens.
He has lifted up the horn of his people for praise from all his faithful ones, the Israelites, the people near to him. Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh. Sing to Yahweh a new song; sing his praise in the assembly of the faithful ones.
Let Israel rejoice in the one who made them; let the people of Zion rejoice in their king.
Let them praise his name with dancing; let them sing praises to him with tambourine and harp.
For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people; he glorifies the humble with salvation.
Let the godly rejoice in victory; let them sing for joy on their beds.
May the praises of God be in their mouths and a two-edged sword in their hand
to execute vengeance on the nations and acts of punishment on the peoples.
They will bind their kings with chains and their nobles with iron shackles.
They will execute the judgment that is written. This will be an honor for all his faithful ones. Praise Yahweh.
Praise Yahweh. Praise God in his holy place; praise him in the mighty heavens.
Praise him for his mighty acts; praise him for his surpassing greatness.
Praise him with the blast of the horn; praise him with lute and harp.
Praise him with tambourines and dancing; praise him with stringed instruments and wind instruments.
Praise him with loud cymbals; praise him with high sounding cymbals.
Let everything that has breath praise Yahweh. Praise Yahweh.
The proverbs of Solomon son of David, the king of Israel.
These proverbs are to teach wisdom and instruction, to teach words of insight,
that you may receive instruction in order to live by doing what is right, just, and fair.
These proverbs are also to give wisdom to the naive, and to give knowledge and discretion to young people.
Let wise people listen and increase their learning, and let discerning people get guidance,
to understand proverbs, sayings, and words of wise people and their riddles.
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge— fools despise wisdom and instruction.
My son, hear the instruction of your father and do not lay aside the rules of your mother;
they will be a graceful wreath for your head and pendants hanging from your neck.
My son, if sinners try to entice you into their sin, refuse to follow them.
If they say, “Come with us, let us lie in wait for blood, let us hide and attack innocent people for no reason.
Let us swallow them up alive, like Sheol takes away those who are healthy, and make them like those who fall into the pit.
We shall find all kinds of valuable things; we will fill our houses with what we steal from others.
Throw in your lot with us; we will all have one purse together.”
My son, do not walk down that road with them; do not let your foot touch where they walk;
their feet run to evil and they hurry to shed blood.
For it is useless to spread the net in the sight of any bird.
These men lie in wait for their own blood— they set an ambush for their own lives.
So are the ways of everyone who gains riches by injustice; unjust gain takes away the lives of those who hold on to it.
Wisdom cries aloud in the street, she raises her voice in the open places;
at the head of the noisy streets she cries out, at the entrance of the city gates she speaks,
“How long, you naive people, will you love being naive? How long, you mockers, will you delight in mockery, and how long, you fools, will you hate knowledge?
Pay attention to my correction; I will pour out my thoughts to you; I will make my words known to you.
I have called, and you have refused to listen; I reached out with my hand, but there was no one who paid attention.
But you have ignored all my instruction and paid no attention to my correction.
I will laugh at your calamity, I will mock you when the terror comes—
when your fearful dread comes like a storm and disaster sweeps over you like a whirlwind, when distress and anguish come upon you.
Then they will call upon me, and I will not answer; they will desperately call for me, but they will not find me.
Because they hate knowledge and did not choose the fear of Yahweh,
they would not follow my instruction, and they despised all my correction.
They will eat the fruit of their ways, and with the fruit of their schemes they will be filled.
For the naive are killed when they turn away, and the indifference of fools will destroy them.
But whoever listens to me will live in safety and will rest secure with no fear of disaster.”
My son, if you receive my words and treasure up my commandments with you,
make your ears pay attention to wisdom and incline your heart to understanding.
If you cry out for understanding and raise your voice for it,
if you seek it like you would seek silver and search for understanding as you would seek hidden treasures,
then you will understand the fear of Yahweh and you will find the knowledge of God.
For Yahweh gives wisdom, from his mouth comes knowledge and understanding.
He stores up sound wisdom for those who please him, he is a shield for those who walk in integrity,
he guards the paths of justice and he will preserve the way of those who are faithful to him.
Then you will understand righteousness, justice, and equity, and every good path.
For wisdom will come into your heart, and knowledge will be pleasant to your soul.
Discretion will watch over you, understanding will guard you.
They will rescue you from the way of evil, from those who speak perverse things,
who abandon the right paths and walk in the ways of darkness.
They rejoice when they do evil and delight in the perversities of evil.
They follow crooked paths, and using deception they hide their tracks.
Wisdom and discretion will save you from an adulterous woman, from an immoral woman and her flattering words.
She forsakes the companion of her youth and forgets the covenant of her God.
For her house leads down to death and her tracks will lead you to those in the grave.
All who go in to her will not return again and they will not find the paths of life.
So you will walk in the way of good people and follow the paths of righteous people.
For those doing right will make a home in the land, and those with integrity will remain in it.
But the wicked will be cut off from the land, and the faithless will be cut off from it.
My son, do not forget my commands and keep my teachings in your heart,
for length of days and years of life and peace they will add to you.
Do not let covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness ever leave you, tie them together about your neck, write them on the tablet of your heart.
Then you will find favor and a good reputation in the sight of God and man.
Trust in Yahweh with all your heart and do not lean on your own understanding;
in all your ways acknowledge him and he will make your paths straight.
Do not be wise in your own eyes; fear Yahweh and turn away from evil.
It will be healing to your flesh and refreshment for your body.
Honor Yahweh with your wealth and with the firstfruits of all your produce,
and your storehouses will be filled up and your vats will be bursting, full of new wine.
My son, do not despise Yahweh's instruction and do not hate his rebuke,
for Yahweh disciplines those he loves, as a father deals with a son who pleases him.
The one who finds wisdom is blessed; he also gets understanding.
What you gain from wisdom is better than what silver will give in return and its profit is better than gold.
Wisdom is more precious than jewels and nothing you desire can compare to her.
She has length of days in her right hand; in her left hand are riches and honor.
Her ways are ways of kindness and all her paths are peace.
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of it, those who hold on to it are happy.
By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth, by understanding he established the heavens.
By his knowledge the depths broke open and the clouds dropped their dew.
My son, keep sound judgment and discernment, and do not lose sight of them.
They will be life to your soul and an adornment of favor to wear around your neck.
Then you will walk on your way in safety and your foot will not stumble;
when you lie down, you will not be afraid; when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
Do not be afraid of sudden terror or devastation caused by the wicked, when it comes,
for Yahweh will be on your side and will keep your foot from being caught in a trap.
Do not withhold good from those who deserve it, when it is in your power to act.
Do not say to your neighbor, “Go, and come again, and tomorrow I will give it,” when you have the money with you.
Do not make a plan to harm your neighbor— the one who lives close and trusts you.
Do not argue with a person without a reason, when he has done nothing to harm you.
Do not envy a violent person or choose any of his ways.
For the devious person is detestable to Yahweh, but he brings the upright person into his confidence.
The curse of Yahweh is on the house of the wicked person, but he blesses the home of righteous people.
He mocks mockers, but he gives his favor to humble people.
Wise people inherit honor, but fools will be lifted up in their shame.
Listen, sons, to a father's instruction, and pay attention so you will know what understanding is.
I am giving you good instructions; do not forsake my teaching.
When I was a son of my father, the tender and only child of my mother,
he taught me and said to me, “Let your heart hold fast to my words; keep my commands and live.
Acquire wisdom and understanding; do not forget and do not reject the words of my mouth;
do not abandon wisdom and she will watch over you; love her and she will keep you safe.
Wisdom is the most important thing, so acquire wisdom and spend all you own so you can get understanding.
Cherish wisdom and she will exalt you; she will honor you when you embrace her.
She will put a wreath of honor on your head; she will give you a beautiful crown.”
Listen, my son, and pay attention to my words, and you will have many years in your life.
I direct you in the way of wisdom; I lead you down straight paths.
When you walk, no one will stand in your way and if you run, you will not stumble.
Hold on to instruction, do not let it go; guard it, for it is your life.
Do not follow the path of the wicked and do not go along the way of those who do evil.
Avoid it, do not go on it; turn away from it and go another way.
For they cannot sleep until they do evil and they are robbed of sleep until they cause someone to stumble.
For they eat the bread of wickedness and drink the wine of violence.
But the path of righteous people is like the first light that grows brighter; it shines more and more until the fullness of the day comes.
The way of the wicked is like darkness— they do not know what it is they stumble over.
My son, pay attention to my words; incline your ear to my sayings.
Do not let them turn away from your eyes; keep them in your heart.
For my words are life to those who find them and health to their whole body.
Keep your heart safe and guard it with all diligence, for from it flow the springs of life.
Put crooked speech away from you and put corrupt talk far from you.
Let your eyes look straight ahead and fix your gaze straight before you.
Make a level path for your foot; then all your ways will be secure.
Do not turn aside to the right or to the left; turn your foot away from evil.
My son, pay attention to my wisdom; incline your ears to my understanding,
so you may learn about discretion and your lips may protect knowledge.
For the lips of an adulteress drip with honey and her mouth is smoother than oil,
but in the end she is as bitter as wormwood, cutting like a sharp sword.
Her feet go down to death; her steps go all the way to Sheol.
She gives no thought to the path of life. Her footsteps wander; she does not know where she is going.
Now, my sons, listen to me; do not turn away from listening to the words of my mouth.
Keep your path far away from her and do not come near the door of her house.
In that way you will not give away your honor to others or years of your life to a cruel person;
strangers will not feast on your wealth; what you have worked for will not go into the house of strangers.
At the end of your life you will groan when your flesh and your body waste away.
You will say, “How I hated instruction and my heart despised correction!
I would not obey my teachers or incline my ear to my instructors.
I was almost completely ruined in the midst of the assembly, among the gathering of the people.”
Drink water from your own cistern and drink running water from your own well.
Should your springs overflow everywhere and your streams of water flow in the public squares?
Let them be for yourself alone and not for strangers with you.
May your fountain be blessed and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth,
for she is a loving deer and a graceful doe. Let her breasts satisfy you at all times; may you be continually intoxicated by her love.
For why should you, my son, be captivated by an adulteress; why should you embrace the breasts of an immoral woman?
Yahweh sees everything a person does and watches all the paths he takes.
A wicked person will be seized by his own iniquities; the cords of his sin will hold him tight.
He will die because he lacks instruction; he is led astray by his great foolishness.
My son, if you set aside your money as a guarantee for your neighbor's loan, if you gave your promise for a loan of someone you do not know,
then you have laid a trap for yourself by your promise and you have been caught by the words of your mouth.
When you are caught by your words, my son, do this and save yourself, since you have fallen into the hand of your neighbor; go and humble yourself and make your case before your neighbor.
Give your eyes no sleep and your eyelids no slumber.
Save yourself like a gazelle from the hand of the hunter, like a bird from the hand of the fowler.
Look at the ant, you lazy person, consider her ways, and be wise.
It has no commander, officer, or ruler,
yet it prepares its food in the summer and during the harvest it stores up what it will eat.
How long will you sleep, you lazy person? When will you rise from your sleep?
“A little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to rest”—
and your poverty will come like a robber and your needs like an armed soldier.
A worthless person—a wicked man— lives by the crookedness of his speech,
winking his eyes, making signals with his feet and pointing with his fingers.
He plots evil with deceit in his heart; he always stirs up discord.
Therefore his disaster will overtake him in an instant; in a moment he will be broken beyond healing.
There are six things that Yahweh hates, seven that are disgusting to him.
The eyes of a proud person, a tongue that lies, hands that shed the blood of innocent people,
a heart that invents wicked schemes, feet that quickly run to do evil,
a witness who breathes out lies and one who sows discord among brothers.
My son, obey the command of your father and do not forsake the teaching of your mother.
Always bind them on your heart; tie them about your neck.
When you walk, they will guide you; when you sleep, they will watch over you; and when you wake up, they will teach you.
For the commands are a lamp, and the teaching is a light; the corrections that come by instruction are the way of life.
It keeps you from the immoral woman, from the smooth words of an immoral woman.
Do not lust in your heart after her beauty and do not let her capture you with her eyelashes.
Sleeping with a prostitute can cost the price of a loaf of bread, but the wife of another may cost you your very life.
Can a man carry a fire against his chest without burning his clothes?
Can a man walk on hot coals without scorching his feet?
So is the man who sleeps with his neighbor's wife; the one who sleeps with her will not go unpunished.
People do not despise a thief if he steals to satisfy his need when he is hungry.
Yet if he is caught, he will pay back seven times what he stole; he must give up everything of value in his house.
The one who commits adultery has no sense; the one who does it destroys himself.
Wounds and shame are what he deserves and his disgrace will not be wiped away.
For jealousy makes a man furious; he will show no mercy when he takes his revenge.
He will accept no compensation and he cannot be bought off, though you offer him many gifts.
My son, keep my words and store up my commands within yourself.
Keep my commands and live and keep my instruction as the apple of your eye.
Tie them on your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart.
Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,” and call understanding your kinsman,
in order to keep yourself from the adulterous woman, from the immoral woman with her smooth words.
At the window of my house I was looking out through the lattice.
I looked at the naive people, and I noticed among the young men a youth who had no sense.
That young man passed down the street near her corner, and he went toward her house.
It was twilight, in the evening of the day, at the time of night and darkness.
There a woman met him, dressed like a prostitute, with a false heart.
She was loud and wayward; her feet did not stay at home.
Now in the streets, then in the market place, and at every corner she waited in ambush.
So she grabbed him and kissed him, with a strong face she said to him,
“I made my peace offering today, I paid my vows,
so came I out to meet you, to eagerly seek your face, and I have found you.
I have spread coverings on my bed, colored linens from Egypt.
I have sprinkled my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
Come, let us drink our fill of love until morning; let us take great pleasure in acts of love.
For my husband is not at his house; he has gone on a long journey.
He took a bag of money with him; he will return on the day of the full moon.”
With much talk she turned him; with her smooth lips she misled him.
He went after her suddenly like an ox going to slaughter, like a deer caught in a trap,
until an arrow pierces through its liver. He was like a bird rushing into a snare. He did not know that it would cost his life.
Now, my sons, listen to me; pay attention to the words of my mouth.
May your heart not turn aside onto her paths; do not be led astray onto her paths.
She has caused many people to fall down pierced; her dead victims are very many.
Her house is on the paths to Sheol; they go down to the dark bedrooms of death.
Does not Wisdom call out? Does not Understanding raise her voice?
On the hilltops beside the road, at the crossroads, Wisdom has taken her stand.
Before the gates at the entrance into the city, at the entrances into the city, she calls out.
“It is to you, people, that I call; my voice is for the sons of mankind.
You who are naive, learn wisdom; and you who are foolish, you must get an understanding mind.
Listen, because I will speak of noble things, and when my lips open I will say upright things.
For my mouth speaks what is trustworthy, and wickedness is disgusting to my lips.
All the words of my mouth are just; in them is nothing twisted or misleading.
All of them are straight for the person who understands; my words are upright for those who find knowledge.
Acquire my instruction rather than silver; acquire knowledge rather than pure gold.
For Wisdom is better than jewels; no treasure is equal to her.
I, Wisdom, live with Prudence, and I possess knowledge and discretion.
The fear of Yahweh is to hate evil. I hate pride and arrogance, the evil way, and perverted speech. I hate them.
I have good advice and sound wisdom; I am insight; strength belongs to me.
By me kings reign, and rulers make laws that are just.
By me princes rule, nobles, and all who govern with justice.
I love those who love me, and those who diligently seek me, find me.
With me are riches and honor, lasting wealth and righteousness.
My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold; my produce is better than pure silver.
I walk in the path of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of justice.
As a result, I make those who love me inherit wealth; I fill up their treasuries.
Yahweh created me at the beginning, the first of his deeds then.
In ages long ago I was made—from the first, from the beginnings of the earth.
Before there were oceans, I was given birth— before there were springs abounding with water.
Before the mountains were settled and before the hills, I was born.
I was born before Yahweh had made the earth or the fields, or even the first dust in the world.
I was there when he established the heavens, when he drew a circle on the surface of the deep.
I was there when he established the clouds above and when the springs in the deep became fixed.
I was there when he made his limit for the sea, so the waters should not spread beyond his command, and when there was set the limit for the foundations of the dry land.
I was beside him, as a skilled craftsman; I was his delight day after day, always rejoicing before him.
I was rejoicing in his whole world, and my delight was in the sons of mankind.
Now, my sons, listen to me, for those who keep my ways will be blessed.
Listen to my instruction and be wise; do not neglect it.
The one who listens to me will be blessed. He will be watching every day at my doors, waiting beside the posts of my doors.
For whoever finds me, finds life, and he will find the favor of Yahweh.
But he who fails, harms his own life; all who hate me love death.”
Wisdom has built her own house; she has carved seven pillars out of rocks.
She has slaughtered her animals; she has mixed her wine; and she has set her table.
She has sent out her maids; she calls out from the highest points of the city,
“Who is naive? Let him turn aside here!” To the one lacking good sense she speaks.
“Come, eat my food, and drink the wine I have mixed.
Leave your naive actions and live; walk in the path of understanding.
Whoever disciplines a mocker receives abuse, and whoever rebukes a wicked person receives insults.
Do not reprove a mocker, or he will hate you; reprove a wise man, and he will love you.
Give to a wise person, and he will become even wiser; teach a righteous person, and he will add to his learning.
The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
For through me your days will be multiplied, and years of life will be added to you.
If you are wise, you are wise for yourself, and if you mock, you will carry it by yourself.”
The woman of foolishness is ignorant; she is untaught and knows nothing.
She sits at the door of her house, on a seat in the highest places of the town.
She is calling out to those who pass by in the streets, to people walking straight on their way.
“Let anyone who is naive turn aside here,” she says to those who have no sense.
“Stolen waters are sweet, and bread of secrecy is delicious.”
But he does not know that the dead are there, that her invited guests are in the depths of Sheol.
The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son makes his father rejoice but a foolish son brings grief to his mother.
Treasures accumulated by wickedness have no value, but doing what is right keeps you from death.
Yahweh does not let the soul of the righteous person go hungry, but he frustrates the cravings of the wicked.
A lazy hand causes a person to be poor, but the hand of the diligent person gains riches.
A wise son gathers a crop in the summer, but it is disgraceful for him to sleep during harvest.
Gifts from God are upon the head of the righteous person, but the mouth of the wicked covers up violence.
The righteous person makes those who remember him happy, but the name of the wicked will rot away.
Those who are sensible accept commands, but a talkative fool will come to ruin.
He who walks in integrity walks in safety, but the one who makes his ways crooked, he will be found out.
He who winks the eye causes grief, but a talkative fool will be thrown down.
The mouth of the righteous person is a water spring of life, but the mouth of the wicked covers up violence.
Hatred stirs up conflicts, but love covers over all offenses.
Wisdom is found on the lips of a discerning person, but a rod is for the back of the one who has no sense.
Wise men store up knowledge, but the mouth of a fool brings destruction near.
The wealth of a rich man is his fortified city; the poverty of the poor is their destruction.
The wage of the righteous person leads to life; the profit of the wicked leads them to sin.
There is a path to life for the one who follows discipline, but the one who rejects correction is led astray.
Whoever conceals hatred has lying lips, and whoever spreads slander is a fool.
When there are many words, transgression is not lacking, but he who is careful in what he says is wise.
The tongue of the righteous person is pure silver; there is little value in the heart of the wicked.
The lips of the righteous person nourish many, but fools die because of their lack of sense.
The good gifts of Yahweh bring wealth and he adds no pain to it.
Wickedness is a game a fool plays, but wisdom is a pleasure to a man of understanding.
The fear of the wicked person will overtake him, but the desire of righteous people will be granted.
The wicked are like the storm that passes by, and they are no more, but the righteous person is a foundation that lasts forever.
Like vinegar on the teeth and smoke in the eyes, so is the sluggard to those who send him.
The fear of Yahweh prolongs life, but the years of the wicked will be short.
The hope of righteous people is their joy, but the years of wicked people will be short.
The way of Yahweh protects those who have integrity, but it is destruction for the wicked.
The righteous person will never be overthrown, but the wicked will not remain in the land.
Out of the mouth of the righteous person comes the fruit of wisdom, but the perverse tongue will be cut out.
The lips of the righteous person know what is acceptable, but the mouth of the wicked, they know what is perverse.
Yahweh hates scales that are not accurate, but he delights in a precise weight.
When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.
The integrity of the upright guides them, but the crooked ways of the treacherous destroy them.
Wealth is worthless on the day of wrath, but doing right keeps you from death.
The right conduct of a blameless person makes his way straight, but the wicked will fall because of their own wickedness.
The right conduct of those who please God keeps them safe, but the treacherous are trapped by their cravings.
When a wicked man dies, his hope perishes and the hope that was in his strength comes to nothing.
The righteous person is kept away from trouble and it comes upon the wicked instead.
With his mouth the godless person destroys his neighbor, but through knowledge righteous people are kept safe.
When righteous people prosper, a city rejoices; when the wicked perish, there are shouts of joy.
Through the good gifts of those who please God, the city becomes great; by the mouth of the wicked, the city is torn down.
The man who has contempt for his friend has no sense, but a man of understanding keeps quiet.
Whoever goes around slandering reveals secrets, but a faithful person keeps a matter covered.
Where there is no wise direction, a nation falls, but victory comes by consulting many advisors.
Whoever guarantees a loan for a stranger will surely suffer harm, but the one who hates giving a pledge in that kind of promise is safe.
A gracious woman gets honor, but ruthless people grasp for wealth.
A kind person benefits himself, but one who is cruel hurts himself.
The wicked person lies to get his wages, but one who sows what is right reaps the wages of truth.
An honest person who does what is right will live, but the one who pursues evil will die.
Yahweh hates those whose hearts are perverse, but he delights in those whose ways are blameless.
Be sure of this—the wicked person will not go unpunished, but the descendants of righteous people will be kept safe.
Like a gold ring in a pig's nose is a beautiful woman without discretion.
The desires of righteous people result in good, but wicked people can only hope for wrath.
There is one who scatters—he will accumulate even more; another withholds what he should give—he comes to poverty.
The generous person will prosper and the one who gives water to others will have water for himself.
People curse the man who refuses to sell grain, but good gifts crown the head of him who sells it.
The one who diligently seeks good is also seeking favor, but the one who searches for evil will find it.
Those who trust in their riches will fall, but like the leaf, righteous people will flourish.
The one who brings trouble on his own household will inherit the wind and the fool will become a servant to the wise of heart.
The righteous person will be like a tree of life, but violence takes away lives.
Behold! The righteous person receives what he deserves; how much more the wicked and the sinner!
Whoever loves discipline loves knowledge, but the one who hates correction is stupid.
Yahweh gives favor to a good man, but he condemns a man who makes evil plans.
A person cannot be established by wickedness, but righteous people cannot be uprooted.
A worthy wife is her husband's crown, but she who brings shame is like a disease that rots his bones.
The plans of the righteous are just, but the advice of the wicked is deceitful.
The words of wicked people are an ambush waiting for a chance to kill, but the words of the upright keep them safe.
Wicked people are overthrown and they are gone, but the house of the righteous person will stand.
A person is praised by how much wisdom he has, but the one who makes perverse choices is despised.
Better to have an unimportant position—only being a servant— than to brag about your importance but have no food.
The righteous person cares about the needs of his animal, but even the compassion of the wicked is cruel.
The one who works his land will have plenty of food, but whoever chases after worthless projects has no sense.
The wicked person desires what evil men have stolen from others, but the fruit of righteous people comes from themselves.
An evil person is trapped by his wicked talk, but the righteous person escapes from trouble.
From the fruit of his words a person is filled with good things, just as the work of his hands rewards him.
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes, but a wise man listens to advice.
A fool shows his anger at once, but one who ignores an insult is prudent.
The one who speaks the truth says what is right, but a false witness tells lies.
The words of one who speaks rashly are like the thrusts of a sword, but the tongue of the wise brings healing.
Truthful lips last forever, but a lying tongue is only for a moment.
There is deceit in the hearts of those who plan to do evil, but joy comes to the advisors of peace.
No ill comes on the righteous person, but wicked people are filled with difficulties.
Yahweh hates lying lips, but those who live faithfully are his delight.
A prudent man conceals his knowledge, but the heart of fools shouts out folly.
The hand of the diligent will rule, but lazy people will be put to forced labor.
Anxiety in the heart of a person weighs him down, but a good word makes him glad.
The righteous person is a guide for his friend, but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
Lazy people would not roast their own game, but the diligent man will obtain precious wealth.
Those who walk in the right way find life and in its path there is no death.
A wise son hears his father's instruction, but a mocker will not listen to rebuke.
From the fruit of his mouth a person enjoys good things, but the appetite of the treacherous is for violence.
The one who guards his mouth protects his life, but the one who opens wide his lips will ruin himself.
The appetite of lazy people craves but gets nothing, but the appetite of diligent people will be richly satisfied.
The righteous person hates lies, but a wicked person makes himself repugnant, and he does what is shameful.
Righteousness protects those who are faultless in their path, but wickedness turns away those who commit sin.
There is someone who enriches himself, but has nothing at all, and there is someone who gives everything away, yet is truly wealthy.
The ransom of a rich man's life is his wealth, but a poor person does not hear a threat.
The light of righteous people rejoices, but the lamp of wicked people will be put out.
Pride only breeds conflict, but for those who listen to good advice there is wisdom.
Wealth dwindles away when there is too much vanity, but the one who makes money by working with his hand will make his money grow.
When hope is postponed, it breaks the heart, but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.
Whoever despises instruction brings destruction on himself, but he who respects the commandment will be rewarded.
The teaching of a wise person is a fountain of life, turning you away from the snares of death.
Good insight wins favor, but the way of the treacherous is never-ending.
Prudent people act out of knowledge in every decision, but a fool parades his folly.
A wicked messenger falls into trouble, but a faithful envoy brings reconciliation.
The one who ignores instruction will have poverty and shame, but honor will come to him who learns from correction.
A longing realized is sweet to the appetite, but fools hate to turn away from evil.
Walk with wise people and you will be wise, but the companion of fools will suffer harm.
Disaster runs after sinners, but righteous people are rewarded with good.
A good person leaves an inheritance for his grandchildren, but a sinner's wealth is stored up for the righteous person.
An unplowed field owned by the poor could produce much food, but it is swept away by injustice.
The one who does not discipline his son hates him, but one who loves his son is careful to instruct him.
The righteous person eats until he satisfies his appetite, but the stomach of the wicked is always hungry.
The wise woman builds her house, but a foolish woman tears it down with her own hands.
The one who walks uprightly fears Yahweh, but the one who is dishonest in his ways despises him.
From the mouth of a fool comes an offshoot of his pride, but the lips of the wise will preserve them.
Where there are no cattle the feeding trough is clean, but an abundant crop can come by the strength of an ox.
A faithful witness does not lie, but a false witness breathes out lies.
A mocker seeks wisdom and there is none, but knowledge comes easy to the one who is discerning.
Walk away from a foolish person, for you will not find knowledge on his lips.
The wisdom of the prudent person is to understand his own way, but the folly of fools is deception.
Fools mock when the guilt offering is sacrificed, but among the upright favor is shared.
The heart knows its own bitterness and no stranger shares its joy.
The house of wicked people will be destroyed, but the tent of upright people will flourish.
There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end only leads to death.
A heart can laugh but still be in pain and joy may end up being grief.
The one who is not faithful will get what his ways deserve, but a good person will get what is his.
The one who is naive believes everything, but the prudent man thinks about his steps.
A wise man fears and turns away from evil, but the fool confidently dismisses a warning.
One who is quick to become angry does foolish things, and a person who makes evil schemes is hated.
The naive inherit foolishness, but prudent people are crowned with knowledge.
Evil people will bow down before those who are good and those who are wicked will bow down at the gates of the righteous person.
The poor person is hated even by his own companions, but the rich people have many friends.
The one who shows contempt for his neighbor is sinning, but the one who shows favor to the poor is blessed.
Do not those who plot evil go astray? But those who plan to do good will receive covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness.
With all hard work comes a profit, but when there is only talk, it leads to poverty.
The crown of wise people is their wealth, but the folly of fools brings them only more folly.
A truthful witness saves lives, but a false witness breathes out lies.
When someone fears Yahweh, he also has much confidence in him; these things will be like a strong place of protection for this man's children.
The fear of Yahweh is a fountain of life, so that a person may turn away from the snares of death.
The glory of a king is found in the great number of his people, but without people the prince is ruined.
A patient person has great understanding, but the quick-tempered person exalts folly.
A tranquil heart is life for the body, but envy rots the bones.
The one who oppresses the poor curses his Maker, but the one who shows favor to the needy honors him.
The wicked person is brought down by his evil actions, but the righteous person has a refuge even in death.
Wisdom rests in the heart of the discerning, but even among fools she lets herself be known.
Doing what is right exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
The favor of the king is with the servant who acts prudently, but his anger is for the one who acts shamefully.
A gentle answer turns away wrath, but a harsh word stirs up anger.
The tongue of wise people compliments knowledge, but the mouth of fools pours out folly.
The eyes of Yahweh are everywhere, keeping watch over the evil and the good.
A healing tongue is a tree of life, but a deceitful tongue crushes the spirit.
A fool has contempt for his father's instruction, but he who learns from correction is prudent.
In the house of the righteous person there is great treasure, but the earnings of the wicked person give him trouble.
The lips of wise people scatter knowledge about, but not so the hearts of fools.
Yahweh hates the sacrifices of wicked people, but the prayer of upright people is his delight.
Yahweh hates the way of wicked people, but he loves the one who pursues what is right.
Harsh discipline awaits anyone who forsakes the way and he who hates correction will die.
Sheol and destruction are open before Yahweh; how much more the hearts of the sons of mankind?
The mocker resents correction; he will not go to the wise.
A joyful heart makes the face cheerful, but heartache crushes the spirit.
The heart of the discerning seeks knowledge, but the mouth of fools feeds on folly.
All the days of oppressed people are miserable, but a cheerful heart has an unending feast.
Better is little with the fear of Yahweh than great treasure with confusion.
Better is a meal with vegetables where there is love than a fatted calf served with hatred.
An angry man stirs up arguments, but a person who is slow to anger quiets a quarrel.
The path of the sluggard is like a place with a hedge of thorns, but the path of the upright is a built-up highway.
A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish person despises his mother.
Folly delights a person who lacks sense, but the one who has understanding walks a straight path.
Plans go wrong where there is no advice, but with numerous advisors they succeed.
A person finds joy when he gives a pertinent reply; how good is a timely word!
The path of life leads upward for prudent people, that they may turn away from Sheol beneath.
Yahweh tears down the house of the proud, but he protects the property of the widow.
Yahweh hates the thoughts of wicked people, but the words of kindness are pure.
The robber brings trouble to his family, but the one who hates bribes will live.
The heart of the righteous person ponders before it answers, but the mouth of wicked people pours out all its evil.
Yahweh is far away from wicked people, but he hears the prayer of righteous people.
The light of the eyes brings joy to the heart and good news is health to the body.
If you pay attention when someone corrects how you live, you will remain among wise people.
The one who rejects discipline despises himself, but he who listens to correction gains understanding.
The fear of Yahweh teaches wisdom and humility comes before honor.
The plans of the heart belong to a person, but from Yahweh comes the answer from his tongue.
All of a person's ways are pure in his own eyes, but Yahweh weighs the spirits.
Commit your works to Yahweh and your plans will succeed.
Yahweh has made everything for its purpose, even the wicked for the day of trouble.
Yahweh hates everyone who has an arrogant heart, but be sure of this, they will not go unpunished.
By covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness iniquity is atoned for and by the fear of Yahweh people turn away from evil.
When a person's ways are pleasing to Yahweh, he makes even that person's enemies to be at peace with him.
Better is a little with what is right, than a large income with injustice.
In his heart a person plans out his way, but Yahweh directs his steps.
Insightful decisions are on the lips of a king, his mouth should not betray justice.
Honest scales come from Yahweh; all the weights in the bag are his work.
When kings do wicked things, that is something to be despised, for a throne is established by doing what is right.
A king delights in lips that say what is right and he loves the one who speaks directly.
A king's wrath is a messenger of death but a wise man will try to calm his anger.
In the light of a king's face is life and his favor is like a cloud that brings a spring rain.
How much better it is to get wisdom than gold. To get understanding should be chosen more than silver.
The highway of upright people turns away from evil; the one who protects his life guards his way.
Pride comes before destruction and a haughty spirit before a downfall.
It is better to be humble among poor people than to divide the spoil with proud people.
Whoever contemplates what they are taught will find what is good, and those who trust in Yahweh will be blessed.
The one who is wise in heart is called discerning and sweetness of speech improves the ability to teach.
Understanding is a fountain of life to the one who has it, but the instruction of fools is their foolishness.
The heart of a wise person gives insight to his mouth and adds persuasiveness to his lips.
Pleasant words are a honeycomb— sweet to the soul and healing to the bones.
There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way to death.
The laborer's appetite works for him; his hunger urges him on.
A worthless person digs up mischief and his speech is like a scorching fire.
A perverse person stirs up conflict and a gossip separates close friends.
A man of violence lies to his neighbor and leads him down a path that is not good.
The one who winks the eye is plotting perverse things; those who purse the lips will bring evil to pass.
Gray hair is a crown of glory; it is gained by living the right way.
It is better to be slow to anger than to be a warrior and one who rules his spirit is stronger than one who conquers a city.
The lots are cast into the lap, but the decision is from Yahweh.
It is better to have quiet with a dry morsel of bread than a house full of feasting with strife.
A wise servant will rule over a son who acts shamefully and will share the inheritance as one of the brothers.
The crucible is for silver and the furnace is for gold, but Yahweh refines hearts.
The evildoer pays attention to wicked lips; a liar gives ear to a destructive tongue.
Whoever mocks the poor insults his Maker and the one who rejoices at misfortune will not go unpunished.
Grandchildren are the crown of the aged and parents bring honor to their children.
Eloquent speech is not suitable for a fool; much less are lying lips suitable for royalty.
A bribe is like a magic stone to the one who gives it; wherever he turns, he succeeds.
Whoever overlooks an offense seeks love, but the one who repeats a matter alienates close friends.
A rebuke goes deeper into a person who has understanding than a hundred blows go into a fool.
An evil person only seeks rebellion, so a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
It is better to meet a bear robbed of her cubs than to meet a fool in his foolishness.
When someone returns evil for good, evil will never leave his house.
The beginning of conflict is like one who releases water everywhere, so walk away from the dispute before it has broken out.
The person who acquits the wicked person and the person who condemns the righteous person— both are an abomination to Yahweh.
Why should a fool pay money to learn about wisdom, when he has no ability to learn it?
A friend is loving at all times and a brother is born for times of trouble.
A man having no sense makes binding promises and becomes responsible for his neighbor's debts.
Whoever loves conflict loves sin; the one who makes the threshold of his door too high causes bones to be broken.
A person who has a crooked heart finds nothing that is good; the one who has a perverse tongue falls into calamity.
Whoever is the parent of a fool brings grief to himself; and the father of a fool has no joy.
A cheerful heart is good medicine, but a broken spirit dries up the bones.
A wicked man accepts a secret bribe to pervert the ways of justice.
The one who has understanding sets his face toward wisdom, but the eyes of a fool are set on the ends of the earth.
A foolish son is a grief to his father and bitterness to the woman who bore him.
Also, it is never good to punish the righteous person; neither is it good to flog noble men who have integrity.
One who has knowledge uses few words and one with understanding is even-tempered.
Even a fool is thought to be wise if he keeps silent; when he keeps his mouth shut, he is considered to be intelligent.
One who isolates himself seeks his own desire and he quarrels with all sound judgment.
A fool finds no pleasure in understanding, but only in revealing what is in his own heart.
When a wicked person comes, contempt comes with him— along with shame and reproach.
The words of a man's mouth are deep waters; the fountain of wisdom is a flowing stream.
It is not good to be partial to the wicked person, nor to deny justice to the righteous person.
A fool's lips bring him conflict and his mouth invites a beating.
A fool's mouth is his ruin and he ensnares himself with his lips.
The words of a gossip are like delicious morsels and they go down into the inner parts of the body.
Also, one who is slack in his work is a brother to the one who destroys the most.
The name of Yahweh is a strong tower; the righteous person runs into it and is safe.
The wealth of the rich is his fortified city and in his imagination it is like a high wall.
Before his downfall a person's heart is proud, but humility comes before honor.
One who answers before listening— it is his folly and shame.
A person's spirit will survive sickness, but a broken spirit who can bear it?
The heart of the intelligent acquires knowledge and the hearing of the wise seeks it out.
A man's gift may open the way and bring him before an important person.
The first to plead his case seems right until his opponent comes and questions him.
Casting the lot settles disputes and separates strong opponents.
An offended brother is harder to be won than a strong city, and quarreling is like the bars of a castle.
From the fruit of his mouth one's stomach is filled; with the harvest of his lips he is satisfied.
Death and life are controlled by the tongue, and those who love the tongue will eat its fruit.
He who finds a wife finds a good thing and receives favor from Yahweh.
A poor person pleads for mercy, but a rich person answers harshly.
The one who claims many friends is brought to ruin by them, but there is a friend who comes closer than a brother.
Better is a poor person who walks in his integrity than one who is perverse in speech and is a fool.
Also, it is not good to have desire without knowledge and the one who runs too fast misses the path.
A person's folly ruins his life and his heart rages against Yahweh.
Wealth adds many friends, but a poor person is separated from his friends.
A false witness will not go unpunished and he who breathes out lies will not escape.
Many will ask for a favor from a generous person and everyone is a friend of the one who gives gifts.
All the brothers of a poor man hate him; how much more do his friends who go far away from him! He calls out to them, but they are gone.
He who gets wisdom loves his own life; he who keeps understanding will find what is good.
A false witness will not go unpunished, but the one who breathes out lies will perish.
It is not fitting for a fool to live in luxury— much less for a slave to rule over princes.
Discretion makes a person slow to anger and it is his glory to overlook an offense.
The wrath of the king is like the roaring of a young lion, but his favor is like dew on the grass.
A foolish son is ruin to his father and a quarreling wife is a constant dripping of water.
A house and wealth are inherited from parents, but a prudent wife is from Yahweh.
Laziness throws a person into a deep sleep, but the one not willing to work will go hungry.
The one who obeys the command guards his life, but the person who does not think about his ways will die.
Whoever is kind to the poor lends to Yahweh and he will repay him for what he has done.
Discipline your son while there is hope and do not set your desire on putting him to death.
A hot-tempered person must pay the penalty; if you rescue him, you will have to do it a second time.
Listen to advice and accept instruction, so you may become wise by the end of your life.
Many are the plans in a person's heart, but it is the purpose of Yahweh that will stand.
Loyalty is what a person desires and a poor person is better than a liar.
Honor for Yahweh leads people to life; anyone who has it will be satisfied and not afflicted by harm.
The sluggard buries his hand in the dish; he will not even bring it back up to his mouth.
Strike a mocker, and the naive person will become prudent; discipline one who is discerning, and he will gain knowledge.
The one who robs his father and chases his mother away is a son who brings shame and reproach.
If you cease to hear instruction, my son, you will stray from the words of knowledge.
A corrupt witness mocks justice and the mouth of the wicked swallows iniquity.
Condemnation is ready for mockers and flogging for the backs of fools.
Wine is a mocker and strong drink is a brawler; whoever is led astray by drink is not wise.
The fear of a king is like the fear of a young lion that is roaring; the one who makes him angry forfeits his life.
It is an honor for anyone to avoid conflict, but every fool jumps into an argument.
The lazy person does not plow in autumn; he seeks a crop at harvest time but will have nothing.
The purpose in a human heart is like deep water, but someone with understanding will draw it out.
Many a person proclaims he is loyal, but who can find one who is faithful?
The righteous person walks in his integrity, and his sons who follow after him will be blessed.
A king who sits on the throne performing the duties of a judge is winnowing with his eyes all the evil that is before him.
Who can say, “I have kept my heart pure; I am clean from my sin”?
Differing weights and unequal measures— Yahweh hates them both.
Even a youth is known by his actions, by whether his conduct is pure and upright.
Ears that hear and eyes that see— Yahweh made them both.
